title: Jeremy Renner Revisits Reno Hospital One Year After Near-Death Snowplow Accident
description: Jeremy Renner is feeling blessed as the first anniversary of his near-death snowplow accident nears. "Rollin through Reno, NV, with joy, blessings, and
content:
Jeremy Renner is feeling blessed as the first anniversary of his near-death snowplow accident nears.

“Rollin through Reno, NV, with joy, blessings, and [pizza]!!!!” he wrote beside a photo of him riding shotgun in his official “Rennervation Foundation” truck. “Stopped by to see kids/superheroes, first responders, and doctors, nurses, and staff at Renown Hospital Paying my respects and celebrating love, life, and the blessings it brings to us all. Thank you and this community for keeping me here… I’m forever in your debt with gratitude.”

Jeremy Renner Hopes to Return to Acting in 2024

On January 1, 2023, the Marvel star was run over by his personal snowplow. Renner was helping unbury a car when he noticed the plow, which was in park, was rolling towards his nephew, Alex. He rushed to push Alex out of its path, and he was hit in the process.

Jeremy Renner suffered over 30 broken bones. In the months that followed, he underwent several surgeries. Doctors had to rebuild his rib cage with metal rods. And he now has metal plates in his face to help support a damaged eye socket. He also has titanium rods in one of his legs and had to relearn how to walk. He’s still recovering today.

“I have been exploring EVERY type of therapy since Jan 14th… every day,” he explained in a Nov 6 post. “Countless hours of physical therapy, peptide injections, IV drips and pushes, stem cell and exosomes, red light / IR therapy, hyperbaric chamber 2.0 atmospheres, cold plunge, and the list goes on and on….”

As of today, Jeremy Renner is through the worst of his struggles. He hopes to return to acting very soon.

Tomorrow, The 52-year-old will mark the official anniversary with the release of a new album titled Wait. He calls the project a “musical diary” that tells the “story of life, death, recovery, all things learned along the way.”

You can pre-order Wait here.
summary: Marvel star Jeremy Renner was hit by a snowplow one year ago, causing over 30 broken bones and undergoing several surgeries. He now has metal plates in his face and titanium rods in his legs, and hopes to return to acting in 2024. Renner's recovery has included extensive physical therapy, peptide injections, IV drips and pushes, stem cell and exosomes, red light / IR therapy, hyperbaric chamber 2.0 atmospheres, and cold plunge. He will celebrate the anniversary with the release of a new album titled Wait, a "musical diary" that tells the story of life, death, recovery, all things learned along the way.

title: UK drivers warned about Highway Code rule that could result in £2,500 fines
description: Drivers are being warned to check their windscreens before setting off, as failing to do so could land them with a hefty fine.
content:
The windscreen is an integral part of the car's structure and, when damaged, could affect visibility.

This in turn can be deemed as a dangerous obstruction to driving.

Damage can be caused by stone chips or loose road debris and can affect how well the driver can see the road, potentially dazzling or creating glare when sunlight or other drivers' headlights hit the glass.

Driving with a damaged windscreen can be considered a motoring offence, as it may be seen as using a vehicle in a dangerous condition. If an accident occurs while driving with a cracked windscreen, motorists could face a more serious charge of "using a vehicle in a dangerous condition."

Under Annex 6 of the Highway Code, "windscreens and windows MUST be kept clean and free from obstructions to vision".
• In colder temperatures, windscreens can freeze and changes in temperature can cause the glass to crack. Therefore, drivers should avoid pouring hot or boiling water directly onto the glass.
• Drivers should replace windscreen wipers once a year to make sure they're removing debris that builds up and could cause a scratch.
• Drivers should check their windscreen for damage and seek help to repair any small cracks and prevent chips from becoming larger.
• Motorists should drive carefully on uneven road surfaces to avoid stones and gravel hitting the glass and be sure to travel at the correct distance from the vehicle in front at all times.

A small crack could see motorists slapped with a £50 Fixed Penalty Notice, and could even result in an MOT fail.

However, a larger crack in a windscreen may result in a £2,500 fine and three points on the licence.
summary: UK drivers have been warned about a Highway Code rule that could result in £2,500 fines for driving with a damaged windscreen. The windscreen, an integral part of the car's structure, can cause damage that can affect visibility and potentially create glare. This could be considered a dangerous obstruction if an accident occurs while driving with such a damaged vehicle. The rule requires that windscreens and windows must be kept clean and free from obstructions to vision. A small crack in a windscreen could lead to a £50 Fixed Penalty Notice, or an MOT fail, but a larger crack in the windscreen may result in a fine of over £200,000. Drivers should replace windscreen wipers once a year to remove debris that builds up and could cause a scratch.

title: 7 movies set in 2024: Highlander 2, Songbird, Apocalypse 2024…
description: By 2023, fiction has heralded a post-apocalyptic world dominated by pesky fungi (The Last of Us), clones remotely controlled to inhabit our place, a war between aliens, the past and the future (The Tomorrow War), a second round of limitless violence. (American Nightmare 2: Anarchy) or the future, where humans…
content:
By 2023, fiction has heralded a post-apocalyptic world dominated by pesky fungi (The Last of Us), clones remotely controlled to inhabit our place, a war between aliens, the past and the future (The Tomorrow War), a second round of limitless violence. (American Nightmare 2: Anarchy) or the future, where humans and mutants are hunted by excellent vigilantes (X-Men Days of Future Past).

Here we are now in 2024, facing a world under ecological, climatic, economic, social, political and geopolitical tension like never before. But how did the 7th art wait for this gift for years? Between COVID-23, a telepathic dog, a hole in the ozone layer, a sterile world, a virtual world, cryogenics, and a crime erased, here are seven visions of 2024 through cinema.

The AlloCiné editorial team and the entire yellow and black team wish you a five-star year and all the best in 2024.

Filmed in less than two weeks (!) in Texas, this 1hr 15 “short feature”, released in US theaters at the time as part of a dual exhibition program, is a pure product of the Cold War and the fear of nuclear conflict. In Space Traveler, a military test pilot (Robert Clarke, a regular in 1950s SF) finds himself caught in a space-time rift that transports him to 2024, a sterile world after nuclear tests where the population is split between the surface. And the underground is either deaf and dumb or mutated (thanks to the iconic Jack Pierce make-up that transformed Boris Karloff into Frankenstein’s monster in 1931). For reference, the film opens with rolling credits “Star Wars style”, seventeen years before George Lucas’ space opera.

Based on a screenplay by novelist Harlan Ellison, acclaimed for his anthology dangerous visions And working on the series Beyond Reality and The Fifth Dimension, Apocalypse 2024 (Boy and His Dog in the original version) immerses the audience in a devastated Earth, seven years after a world war that left rare survivors fighting for the remains. old world Among them is Vicky, played by a young Don Johnson, an outlaw teenager accompanied by a telepathic dog named Blood. This unlikely tandem traverses this post-apocalyptic world and relies on a partnership that is cynical to say the least: a man finds a dog to eat, and a dog helps a man find women to attack. Having become iconic over the years, the feature film was a major influence on George Miller’s creation of Mad Max, but also on the world of the Fallout video game.

Five years after the masterpiece, director Russell Mulcahy reunites Christoph Lambert and Sean Connery for a sequel that breeds inconsistencies and failures. A huge public, critical and financial failure Rebel version Released in 1995 and Special issue released in 2004), to the point that Highlander III is considered a true sequel to the original film, Highlander the Return still offered a dark and desperate vision of 2024, a nocturnal and humid world “à la Blade Runner” where the population survived. Cosmic radiation with laser shield protection. Originally developed by Connor McLeod (turned mortal and scientist) in 1999, the device is run twenty-five years later by a greedy corporation that taxes humanity to benefit from its protection…while the ozone layer is reformed.

Completely eclipsed by the Matrix wave in the summer of 1999, Passé Virtuel (The Thirteenth Floor in the original version) is a little-known SF nugget that deserves to be (re)discovered (barely 25,000 admissions in theaters and a Blu-ray edition dated 2009). Like David Cronenberg’s eXistenZ a few months earlier, Josef Rusnak’s feature film, which crosses dark thriller and science fiction, questions virtual worlds, the border between reality and fantasy, and the possibility of artificial intelligence coming to life. While the inventor of the 1937 digital simulation is murdered after making equally fascinating and dangerous discoveries in this world, his accomplice, the prime suspect in the crime, dives into this virtual past to lead the investigation. To say more… would be a spoiler!

Very carefully released in French cinemas in June 2018 (barely… 663 cinemas!), Realive allows the Spanish Mateo Gil to try his hand at the sci-fi genre. Or at least in anticipation that a feature film that begins in 2024, where human cryogenic technologies are now available, fast-forwards sixty years later, to 2084, with a man condemned to an illness who decides to choose this “frozen sleep” in the hope that one day he can To wake up and care. Without points of reference and separated from the people he loves, he then discovers a world in which he has become a stranger… Matteo Gil, famous for his work as screenwriter of Alejandro Amenabar’s films, including Open Your Eyes, has already touched on this issue. Cryogenics on this film (which spawned the Vanilla Sky remake with Tom Cruise): real Thus it was born when he wondered how the men of the past could integrate into an era different from their own.

In 2024, the US government is preparing to launch the American Peace Initiative (API), a process based on synaptic signaling that will make it impossible for anyone to commit the slightest illegal act. It is this world, “The Last Days of American Crime,” as the film’s title suggests, that is told in the Netflix original The Last Days of American Crime, released in 2020. Written by Karl Gajdusek (Taken, Oblivion, The Last Resort series) and directed by Frenchie Olivier Megaton (Le Transporteur III, Colombiana, Taken 2 and 3), the feature film stars Edgar Ramírez in the shoes of a robber who tries to stage one last coup before API arrives. to prevent him from carrying out his project. A failed heist, as the feature film was very negatively received by critics and the public, with disastrous ratings (1.7 and 1.6 respectively on AlloCiné).

Five years after COVID-19, it’s time for… COVID-23. That’s the closed-off world presented in Songbird, a Michael Bay production shot in commando mode in Los Angeles over two and a half weeks while the city was hit hard by the pandemic. Immune to the virus, the courier, during childbirth, crosses paths with a young woman suspected of contamination: if she is not transferred to a quarantine camp, she will try to save the impossible… Famous faces (Peter Stormare, Demi Moore, Paul Walter Hauser, Alexandra Daddario) surround Cage Apa ( Riverdale) and Sophia Carson (The Descendants), which remains the first film to be shot in Los Angeles while incarcerated.

In the pop culture department, let’s not forget that the post-Avengers Endgame Marvel universe is mostly set in 2024 (even if the year doesn’t ultimately affect the stories). Thus, Spider-Man: Far From Home / Spider-Man: No Way Home, Doctor Strange 2, The Eternals, Shang-Chi, Black Panther 2, as well as the series Falcon and the Winter Soldier, Hawkeye and She-Hulk take place in 2024. The same Refers to the summit clash of Godzilla vs. Kong, the war between vampires and lycans from Underworld: A New Era or the muscular operation led by Bruce Willis, Channing Tatum and Dwayne Johnson in GI Joe Conspiracy. Flash fans will also not forget that their heroes disappeared on the night of April 25, 2024 during his battle against the Reverse-Flash.
summary: The AlloCiné has highlighted seven films set in 2024, including Highlander 2, Songbird, Apocalypse 2024, and The Last of Us. These films depict a world under ecological, climatic, economic, social, political and geopolitical tension. The first film was filmed in Texas and released in theaters as part of a dual exhibition program, Space Traveler, is a product of the Cold War and the fear of nuclear conflict. The second film, Highlander the Return, offers a vision of a nocturnal and humid world where the population survives. The third film, "Passé Virtuel," explores a virtual world where cryogenic technologies are available. The fourth film, which was released in French cinemas in June 2018, allows the Spanish filmmaker Mateo Mateo to explore the sci-fi genre at his hand.

title: Marlene Mattos hospitalized and subjected to tests: ‘The indisposition forced me to go to hospital’
description: The director reassures fans on her Instagram on New Year's Eve, after the intestinal upset: 'Everything will be fine'
content:
Marlene Mattos had a scare on New Year’s Eve. The director was hospitalized on Saturday 30th due to an intestinal disorder. The news was announced via Instagram: “Yesterday I had an intestinal illness which forced me to go to hospital. I am hospitalized for tests which will reveal the cause of this illness. I am calm, everything will be fine”, he wrote, specifying who was in the company of family and friends.

Marlene Mattos received support from followers. Astrid Fontenelle AND Adriana Bombom they loved him. Journalist Felipeh Campos wrote: “Damn iron woman! 2024 needs you with a lot of health and strength, and you will have it!!, I am very happy for everything that is happening in your life, this is nothing compared to everything that’s coming!” he wrote. The director signed this year with the Television network!.
summary: Marlene Mattos, the director of HBO, was hospitalised on New Year's Eve due to an intestinal disorder. The news was announced via Instagram. Following tests, he stated that he was calm and assured that everything will be fine. The support of his followers was shared by Astrid Fontenelle and Adriana Bombom. Journalist Felipeh Campos expressed his love for the director, stating that 2024 needs a lot of health and strength. Marlene Mattos recently signed with TV network!,

title: A ferry with fireworks capsizes in Praia Grande, Sao Paulo coast
description: The artifacts would have been used in the Tupi neighborhood, but according to the city's municipality they all ended up in the water due to the agitation of the tide A few hours ago New Year's Evea ferry with fireworks overturned in the sea Great beach, on the coast of…
content:
The artifacts would have been used in the Tupi neighborhood, but according to the city’s municipality they all ended up in the water due to the agitation of the tide

A few hours ago New Year’s Evea ferry with fireworks overturned in the sea Great beach, on the coast of São Paulo, on the afternoon of this Sunday 31st. The artifacts would have been used to illuminate the sky in the Tupi neighborhood, but according to the report they all ended up in the water due to the agitation of the tide. city ​​hall. There are no reports of injuries in the accident.

In a statement, the administration specifies that a technical team went to the site to remove the fires, which had reached the sandy strip of the beach. “The conditions of the other ferries are being monitored, with the support of the technicians of the Municipality, the Port Authority and the company awarded the tender”, reads the Municipality’s press release.

According to the administration, the presence of fireworks in the sand and water does not present any risk for swimmers, who however “should not take the artifacts with them”, it warns.

The places where the ferries have been installed have been authorized and defined by the Port Authority, based on the tide table, the availability of submarine cables and underwater drains. The city hall announced last Thursday that the entire facility will be equipped with “tugboats to ensure the safety of boats” during the New Year’s Eve celebrations.

The ferry installed in the Tupi neighborhood was one of five ships loaded with fire for the New Year’s Eve party in Praia Grande. The coastal city of Sao Paulo, which has 22 kilometers of coastline, promised a night with 15 minutes of fireworks displays, including musical performances in 10 arenas around the city.
summary: A ferry with fireworks overturned in Praia Grande, Sao Paulo, on the coast of São Paulo, due to the agitation of the tide. The artifacts, which would have been used to illuminate the sky in the Tupi neighborhood, were all found in the water. The incident occurred shortly after the New Year's Eve party. There were no reports of injuries. The administration has stated that the presence of fireworks in the sand and water does not pose any risk for swimmers, but advises them not to take them with them. The places where ferries have been installed have been authorized and defined by the Port Authority, based on the tide table, the availability of submarine cables and underwater drains.

title: Personal reveals 3 tips for keeping your New Year’s resolutions
description: Angélica Almeida, columnist for Sport Life, helps you achieve your fitness goals in a healthy and gradual way Speak my loves!!! Angelica Almeida in the area, last week of the year and last topic of the year. Having fulfilled this feeling of duty, the blog aims to simplify weight loss,…
content:
Angélica Almeida, columnist for Sport Life, helps you achieve your fitness goals in a healthy and gradual way

Speak my loves!!! Angelica Almeida in the area, last week of the year and last topic of the year. Having fulfilled this feeling of duty, the blog aims to simplify weight loss, provide information on exercise and healthy eating.

And when it comes to the end of the year, no one is willing to change their habits, they just want the year to end.

And on the 1st we are full of promise, new plans and motivated with new opportunities for the new year.

But I want to propose the following to you: don’t make promises. Make a deal, a deal with yourself, with your health and well-being. This is independent of the day, time and year.

Next year I will start again, I will only start the diet again on Monday, I will only do physical activity if I have a personal trainer.

Our body is an intelligent machine that works perfectly. It shows signs when we are not well. And we know what we need to do to change, deep down we know.

How to keep your New Year’s resolutions

But before you finalize your deal, I’ll give you some tips to make it real and achievable.

1st I want to lose weight 30kg, before you lose 30, you have to lose 1kg. The macro plan is the whole and the micro is small scale. Week after week, month after month.

Second start date of your move, record that day, but there is no end date, now the change will be permanent, this does not mean that you will not make mistakes. Giving up will not be an option.

3rd self-knowledge, personal investment, if you don’t treat and cure your pain everything will repeat itself. We all have problems, what differs is how we deal with the situation, control your thoughts and increase your energy.

Determines an anchor word, serves to create or edit events, they are activated only in certain cases by you.

When you constantly change your thinking pattern, your brain creates the habit of thinking positively.

What will your phrase or word be?

You can use all the suggestions, build new habits, make agreements, take action with professional support, building your own process of permanent habit change.
summary: Angélica Almeida, columnist for Sport Life, shares her tips for keeping your New Year’s resolutions in a healthy and gradual manner. She suggests that instead of promising new things, make a deal with yourself, with your health and well-being, independent of the day, time and year. The macro plan is the whole and the micro scale, with the goal being to lose 1kg before the start date. The second deal involves permanent change, with professional support and self-knowledge. Finally, self-awareness and personal investment are key to preventing future repeat of problems.

title: The 5 best (and worst) Studio Ghibli films according to critics
description: Studio Ghibli is renowned for its masterpieces that delight viewers of all ages and draw crowds to theaters. Over the years, the Japanese studio has produced a large collection of films, some critically acclaimed while others have received more mixed reviews. Let's now see the worst and best Studio Ghibli…
content:
Studio Ghibli is renowned for its masterpieces that delight viewers of all ages and draw crowds to theaters. Over the years, the Japanese studio has produced a large collection of films, some critically acclaimed while others have received more mixed reviews. Let’s now see the worst and best Studio Ghibli films, according to critics!

Hiromasa Yonebayashi, known for directing “The World of Little People” for Studio Ghibli, returned in 2014 with the adaptation of Joan G. Robinson’s 1967 children’s novel, originally titled “When Marnie Was There.”

Despite an intriguing premise, the execution failed to meet critical expectations, leaving a feeling of dissatisfaction in audiences and placing it as one of the Studio Ghibli films that least possesses the studio’s hallmarks.

Netflix or rent it on Apple TV.

The second film directed by Goro Miyazaki, son of Hayao Miyazaki, represented a significant evolution from his previous work. Released in 2011 but set in the early 1960s, the plot revolves around two high school students who wage a campaign to preserve their school’s old clubhouse from imminent demolition.

Netflix or rent it on Apple TV.

After the events of the 1995 film “Heartbeat”, “Kingdom of Cats” brings back to life one of the supporting characters from the first film, Baron Humbert von Gikkingen. However, the plot revolves around a new character, a high school student with the ability to communicate with cats.

Hiroyuki Morita directed this 2002 film, marking his debut as a feature director, although he has not released a follow-up project to date. The animation was received very lukewarmly and is one of the most forgotten Studio Ghibli films by the public, as well as being significantly inferior to its predecessor.

Considered one of Studio Ghibli’s least acclaimed films, the 2006 adaptation of Ursula K. Le Guin’s fantasy book series “Earthsea” was directed by Goro Miyazaki, who was debuting in the role and is the son of Ghibli founder Hayao Miyazaki.

Goro and his co-writer Keiko Niwa took many liberties with the original stories, which ended up upsetting some audiences. Although it was a success in Japan in 2006, the film received unfavorable reviews when it finally arrived in Western theaters four years later.

Closing the list of the worst Studio Ghibli films is “Aya and the Witch”. After six years, Studio Ghibli has released its first full production (and the return of director Goro Miyazaki since 2011). This coming-of-age story, set in 1990s England, is an adaptation of Diana Wynne Jones’ novel.

Broadcast on Japanese television at the end of 2020, the film marks the first time in Studio Ghibli’s history that a film has been made entirely in CGI, however, the result does not fully capture the particularity and charm found in the studio’s other historical works and is actually considered the studio’s worst film to date.

Opening the list of the best Studio Ghibli films we have a true classic. Released in the same year as one of the studio’s darkest films, the war drama “Grave of the Fireflies” (which will appear again here) was one of Studio Ghibli’s lightest and most comforting productions.

“My Friend Totoro,” directed by Hayao Miyazaki, introduced the title character, a great forest spirit who became an enduring icon for the studio, to the point of being considered the Ghibli equivalent of Mickey Mouse, making appearances in numerous films and in practically every film. imaginable form of merchandising. This particular film is considered an absolute classic of animation and is revered to this day.

Netflix or rent it on Apple TV.

The latest film directed by Isao Takahata, co-founder of Studio Ghibli, is a 2013 hand-drawn fantasy, nominated for an Oscar. Inspired by a 10th-century Japanese folk tale titled “The Story of the Bamboo Cutter,” the film delves into the most ancient roots of Japanese culture and is widely considered one of Studio Ghibli’s best films.

Netflix or rent it on Apple TV.

Honorable Mention: The Boy and the Crane (2023) – Score: 92

After a ten-year hiatus, Hayao Miyazaki returned to the scene in 2023 with his latest masterpiece, which left a strong impression during its premiere.

Although it shares a title with a 1937 novel that is the director’s favorite book, “The Boy and the Crane” features a largely original story by Miyazaki, set during World War II, when a boy moves to the field after a family tragedy. In this new environment he discovers a fantastic world.

The film has not yet premiered in Brazil and other parts of the world and therefore appears as an honorable mention in this list of the best Studio Ghibli films, despite its current rating being enough to place it third on the list .

With the bronze medal for best films from Studio Ghibli, Isao Takahata’s second film for the studio presents yet another drama, partly exploring the year 1982, when a single twenty-year-old from Tokyo visits her relatives in the countryside, evoking memories of his youth in the past. 60’s. The 1991 production, critically acclaimed for its time-jumping narrative, only arrived in Western cinemas in 2016.

Netflix or rent it on Apple TV.

Studio Ghibli’s debut not directed by Miyazaki, this 1988 film is actually the creation of its co-founder, Isao Takahata. Takahata, who would direct four other Studio Ghibli films before his death in 2018, took over direction of this feature.

“Grave of the Fireflies” also stands out for its different tonal approach compared to previous films, dealing with very real and dramatic themes: life in Kobe, Japan, for two children during the intense final months of the Second World War. This is not only one of the studio’s best films, but also one of the most exciting animations ever produced.

The animation is not currently available on streaming services.

Easily ranked among the best animated films ever produced, Hayao Miyazaki’s 2001 masterpiece features an enchanting succession of scenes. The plot follows a young girl who is transported to a fantasy realm inhabited by spirits, and she must find her way back to the real world to save her parents, who have been transformed into pigs by a witch.

Upon its release in Japan, the film earned the title of the highest-grossing film in the country’s history, and its title as one of Studio Ghibli’s best films is virtually unanimous.

In conclusion, Studio Ghibli’s lineup of films reflects the artistic diversity of the studio over the years. While some have received more mixed reviews, others have stood out as true cinematic masterpieces. Regardless of ratings, each film contributes to Studio Ghibli’s rich legacy, continuing to delight and inspire generations of viewers around the world.

The post The 5 best (and worst) Studio Ghibli films according to critics appeared first on Olhar Digital.

entities.data: The Story of the Bamboo Cutter

summary: Japanese animation company, Studio Ghibli, has produced a large number of films, some critically acclaimed and some received mixed reviews. Critics have ranked the worst and best of these films according to critics. The list includes Hiromasa Yonebayashi's "Kingdom of Cats" adaptation of Joan G. Robinson's 1967 children’s novel, "When Marnie Was There," and "Aya and the Witch", which was released in 2002 and is considered one of the most forgotten and inferior to its predecessor. The 2006 adaptation of Ursula K. Le Guin's fantasy book series "Earthsea" was directed by Goro Miyazaki, son of Hayao Miyazaki. Other notable films include "Grave of the Fireflies" and "My Friend Totoro," which is considered a true classic of animation and is revered to this day.

title: And take the debt!  Alexandre Correa owes almost R$40,000 in fines and late IPVA and has an expired driving license, says columnist
description: Alexandre Correa has a debt of almost R$ 40 thousand for not having paid fines and IPVA, says columnist Leo Dias Alessandro Correa accumulate debts that only increase and now another one has come to light. This time the Failure to pay is linked to traffic fines and IPVA (Motor…
content:
Alexandre Correa has a debt of almost R$ 40 thousand for not having paid fines and IPVA, says columnist Leo Dias

Alessandro Correa accumulate debts that only increase and now another one has come to light. This time the Failure to pay is linked to traffic fines and IPVA (Motor vehicle ownership tax). And that’s not all: Ana Hickmann’s ex-husband’s license (National Driving License) has expired and is no longer valid today.

The information is taken from the “Leo Dias” portal. It is worth mentioning that the presenter claimed to have been verbally and physically attacked by the entrepreneur after reporting to the son of couple, with whom they enjoy New Year’s Eve in a resortfamily financial problems.

Ana has already done a number of others Accusations that even concern the forgery of his signature and Alexandre’s participation in a “criminal organization” (everything he denied). All these debts together form a value of one million dollars and several companies are seeking justice to receive what Ana and/or Alexandre owe. Well then.

According to the publication, the businessman has a Triton Sport HPE S. The vehicle has 36 unpaid fines – the absolute majority, 32, in the capital Sao Paulo. And the rest on Brazilian roads.

These fines amount to almost R$7 thousand (R$6,904.53 to be more precise). Already the Failure to pay the IPVA caused the vehicle to accumulate debts of just over R $ 23 thousand (R$ 23,182.65). It turns out that Alexandre also has another vehicle in his name, a 2019 model, a Honda FIT, which also has debts (about R$ 7 thousand).

But it is not …

Alexandre Correa spends 300 thousand reals in two days with a special check, does not honor the debt and suffers yet another lawsuit

Bankrupt? The debts of Ana Hickmann and Alexandre Correa exceed R$10 million. Find out the details

Ana Hickmann sought religious help before her husband, Alexandre Correa, was attacked and sued. Details!

Much more than R$14 million! Ana Hickmann’s ex-husband, Alexandre Correa, reveals the value of the debts and indicates the risk of bankruptcy
summary: Alexandre Correa, the ex-husband of Ana Hickmann, owes almost R$40,000 in fines and late IPVA (Motor Vehicle Ownership Tax) and has an expired driving license, according to columnist Leo Dias. The debts, which together, are valued at a value of one million dollars and several companies are seeking justice for what they are owed. The Triton Sport HPE S. S. has 36 unpaid fines, mostly in Sao Paulo, and the rest on Brazilian roads. Alexandre Correa also has another vehicle, a 2019 model Honda FIT, which also has debts of about R$ 7 thousand. The debt of both these individuals exceed R$10 million.

title: NASCAR Legend Cale Yarborough Dies At 84
description: Cale Yarborough, a brave driver who always tool on challenges that produced three NASCAR Cup Series championships, has died.
content:
Cale Yarborough, a brave driver who always tool on challenges that produced three NASCAR Cup Series championships, has died. He was 84.

Yarborough was a four-time Daytona 500 winner and a five-time victor in the Southern 500 – figures that rank second all-time for each crown-jewel event.

Yarborough scored his first Daytona 500 win in 1968, edging Lee Roy Yarbrough by 50 feet. Months later, he added a victory in the Southern 500 at Darlington that he still held in high regard after his retirement.

His three Cup Series titles came consecutively from 1976-78.

“Cale Yarborough was one of the toughest competitors NASCAR has ever seen,” NASCAR Chairman & CEO Jim France.

“His combination of talent, grit and determination separated Cale from his peers, both on the track and in the record book. He was respected and admired by competitors and fans alike and was as comfortable behind the wheel of a tractor as he was behind the wheel of a stock car. On behalf of the France family and NASCAR, I offer my deepest condolences to the family and friends of Cale Yarborough.”

William Caleb Yarborough was born March 27, 1939, as the oldest of Julian and Annie Yarborough’s three boys in Florence County, South Carolina.

Yarborough caught the eye of Darlington track president and general manager Bob Colvin at a soap-box derby race.

He encouraged the young driver to make his Cup Series debut there in the 1957 Southern 500 as a teenager. He finished 42nd in the 50-car field, but not before drawing the ire of NASCAR officials for not meeting the era’s minimum age requirement of 20 years old.

You May Also Like
summary: Cale Yarborough, a legendary driver who won three NASCAR Cup Series championships and a four-time Daytona 500 winner, has died at the age of 84. Yarborough was a five-time winner in the Southern 500, ranking second all-time for each crown-jewel event. His three Cup Series titles were from 1976-78. His first Daytona 500 win was in 1968, and he added a victory in his Southern 500 at Darlington months later. NASCAR Chairman & CEO Jim France praised Yarborough for his tough competition and dedication.

title: Brock Purdy Makes 49ers Franchise History vs Commanders
description: San Francisco 49ers QB Brock Purdy set the franchise record for passing yards in a single season during Sunday's win over Washington.
content:
Sunday afternoon against the Washington Commanders, Brock Purdy set the San Francisco 49ers single-season passing yards record, for a franchise with a pair of Hall of Fame quarterbacks who came before him.

By passing for 230 yards with two touchdowns in Washington, Purdy upped his yardage total this season to 4,280, surpassing the record previously held by Jeff Garcia, who passed for 4,278 yards during the 2000 campaign.

Stream the NFL on CBS live all season long on Paramount+. Try it FREE!

Thanks in part to the explosive weapons around him, such as MVP candidate Christian McCaffrey at running back, All-Pro tight end George Kittle, and dynamic wide receivers Deebo Samuel and Brandon Aiyuk, Purdy set the record in his 16th start of the season, matching Garcia's games played the year he set the record.

Now that Purdy set the record, there's a legitimate chance that head coach Kyle Shanahan will rest him in the regular season finale, with no pressure to go for the record.

Given the playmaking ability of Purdy's supporting cast, and his ability to facilitate big plays down the field, there's a chance that Purdy could etch his name on several records for the franchise with such a storied quarterback history.

Purdy's feat is all the more impressive because of the fact that he was chosen with the final selection in the 2022 NFL Draft.

Mr. Irrelevant, no longer, Purday played his way into the NFL MVP conversation during much of the 2023 season, and helped clinch the 49ers the No. 1 seed in the NFC Playoffs with Sunday's victory.

Purdy and the 49ers close out the regular season at home against the Los Angeles Rams, but will have a bye week to open the postseason and homefield advantage throughout the playoffs.

keywords.name: the San Francisco 49ers single-season passing yards record

summary: Brock Purdy set the San Francisco 49ers single-season passing yards record during a game against the Washington Commanders, surpassing Jeff Garcia's record of 4,278 yards. The record was set in Purdy's 16th start of the season, matching Garcia's games played the year he set the record. This feat is particularly notable for Purdy, who was chosen with the final selection in the 2022 NFL Draft. The win helped the 49ers secure the No. 1 seed in the NFC Playoffs with a win against the Los Angeles Rams.

title: How to cancel verizon internet
description: Introduction In today’s digital age, having access to fast and reliable internet is increasingly becoming a necessity. However, situations may arise that will require you to cancel your Verizon internet service. This blog will provide
content:
In today’s digital age, having access to fast and reliable internet is increasingly becoming a necessity. Verizon is one of the most popular internet service providers in the U.S, providing internet, TV, and home phone services. However, situations may arise that will require you to cancel your Verizon internet service.

This blog will provide an overview of the Verizon internet cancellation process and the reasons why someone may choose to cancel their Verizon internet service.

Verizon makes the cancellation process for its internet service pretty straightforward. If you are looking to cancel your Verizon internet, you can do so by calling 1.844.837.2262 during business hours. You will also be required to provide your account number for security reasons.

It is important to note that if you are located in CA, FL, or TX, you will need to contact your local provider to cancel service. After canceling your internet service, you should return any Verizon-owned equipment like routers and modems to avoid being charged for them.

If you are moving outside of Verizon’s service area, you may choose to either transfer or cancel your service. If you are moving to an area where Verizon is not available, you will need to cancel your service.

People cancel their Verizon internet services for different reasons, some of which include:

1. Relocating to an area without Verizon service: As mentioned earlier, if you are moving to an area where Verizon is not available, you will need to cancel your Verizon internet service.

2. To switch to a different internet service provider: If you are no longer satisfied with Verizon’s service, you can cancel your service and switch to a different internet service provider.

3. Cost-saving: If you are looking to cut down on expenses, canceling your internet service may be an option.

4. Issues with billing: If you are experiencing issues with your billing, such as incorrect charges, you may decide to cancel your service.

In conclusion, canceling your Verizon internet service is a pretty straightforward process. If you are thinking of canceling your service, it’s essential to know the reasons why people may choose to do so and weigh your options before making a decision.

Verizon is known for its high-quality TV, internet, and home services. However, there may come a time when you need to cancel or suspend your subscription. In those instances, it’s essential to know the proper process to follow. Thankfully, Verizon makes it easy to track and manage your account, even after you’ve disconnected.

Before canceling or suspending your Verizon service, you’ll need to gather your account information. This includes your account number, phone number, and billing address. You may also need to know your username and password if you’re canceling your account online or through the Verizon app.

If you’re uncertain about your account details or need assistance with canceling your service, Verizon provides a variety of resources to help you. title: Polls at north and south around the world: Looking forward into 2024
description: There are elections scheduled in nearly 40 countries, which together account for 41% of the world’s population and 42% of its GDP.
content:
These are the questions that will be answered this year, with a number of countries scheduled to hold elections. In fact, there is the possibility of a change in leadership in nearly 40 countries, which together account for 41% of the world’s population and 42% of its GDP. So, 2024 could reshape global politics and the democratic order.

The most consequential election will be the November one in the United States, where former President Donald Trump is eyeing a return to the White House. With Trump’s various legal challenges, including his trial in the 2021 Capitol riot, yet to begin, it is difficult to tell if he will indeed be on the ballot at all. As things stand, he is polling high enough to set the stage for a rematch with Joe Biden. In that scenario, Trump has a slight lead over Biden nationally.

But world leaders and policy analysts are wary of a US President with an “America first” agenda in the White House again. Abroad, it could endanger US support for Ukraine, participation in NATO, ties with China, efforts towards fighting the climate crisis, and involvement in the Israel-Hamas conflict, including as a key mediator.

At home, apart from the impact on abortion and minority rights, immigration issues and gun control, talks on the US debt ceiling, which affect markets around the world, could be stymied.

Across the Atlantic, British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak — who marked that country’s third leadership switch (after Liz Truss and Boris Johnson) in three years — and his Conservative Party are lagging behind the Labour Party, led by Keir Starmer, in opinion polls.

Sunak’s stint has been exacerbated by ideological schisms in the party, between its right-wing faction and its centrists, particularly over immigration and policing. How the 2024 election in Britain turns out has ramifications for Indian emigration, Scottish independence, and the wars in Ukraine and Gaza.

Closer to home Both Bangladesh and Pakistan will hold elections in the first half of 2024. Political tensions and public dissent are rising ahead of Bangladesh’s polls in January, with the government of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina accused of human rights violations, curbs on press freedoms, and suppression of dissent since she came to power in 2009.

In Pakistan, elections have been postponed to February amid political and economic upheaval that has included the ouster and imprisonment of former prime minister Imran Khan, the return of former premier Nawaz Sharif, and persistently high inflation. Outcomes of the two elections hold implications not only for cross-border ties but also for India’s national security.

In the wider region, the election in Taiwan has the power to upend China-US relations as Beijing strengthens its claim over the self-ruled island. While the US has time and again reiterated its support for the “one-China” policy, it also maintains close ties with the island and has provided it with defence equipment, angering Beijing.

Elections have been known to escalate tensions in the past. In 1996, for instance, the US sent an aircraft carrier into the region in response to China’s military exercises and missile tests ahead of voting.

Martial law President Volodymyr Zelensky has ruled out elections in Ukraine, saying it is “not the time”. The country has been under martial law since Russia invaded in February 2022.

Across the border, Russia is scheduled to hold elections as usual, with President Vladimir Putin — already the longest-serving Russian leader since Joseph Stalin — expected to stay in power. Prominent critics and Opposition leaders have either fled abroad or been jailed. Putin’s re-election is expected to tighten his grip on the country and boost his resolve to annex Ukraine.

Amid the rising popularity of right-wing parties in Europe, elections to the European Parliament — which decide the commission president and the president of the European Council — could bring consequential shifts in the political arena, impacting action and legislation in core areas such as climate action, immigration, and the response to the war in Ukraine.

In South Africa, the African National Congress (ANC), which has been in power since the end of apartheid, and President Cyril Ramaphosa, have come under fire for corruption and crony capitalism as the country struggles to emerge from the effects of the war in Ukraine and the pandemic. Analysts say this might result in an Opposition party coming to power for the first time since 1994.

“Elections are opportunities for political turnover,” says Seema Shah, head of the democracy assessment team at the Stockholm-based think tank International Institute for Democracy and Electoral Assistance (International IDEA). “All the 2024 general elections carry a great deal of weight, especially for the people who are voting. At the global level, many eyes will be on India, the US, South Africa, Mexico and the European Parliament.”

entities.data: International Institute for Democracy and Electoral Assistance

summary: The potential for a change in leadership in nearly 40 countries around the world in 2024 could reshape global politics and the democratic order. The most anticipated election is in November in the US, where former President Donald Trump is seeking a return to the White House. However, it is uncertain if he will even be on the ballot due to ongoing legal challenges and a potential rematch with Joe Biden. This could jeopardise US support for Ukraine, participation in NATO, ties with China, efforts towards fighting the climate crisis, and involvement in the Israel-Hamas conflict. Meanwhile, British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and his Conservative Party are trailing behind the Labour Party in opinion polls. The outcome of the 2024 election could impact Indian emigration, Scottish independence, and the wars in Ukraine and Gaza.

title: Dolphins coach Mike McDaniel laments decision to keep LB Bradley Chubb on field late in blowout loss
description: Miami Dolphins coach Mike McDaniel says “it doesn't look very smart at all” that he kept star linebacker Bradley Chubb on the field late in a 56-19 loss to the Baltimore Ravens
content:
Miami Dolphins head coach Mike McDaniel watches his team warm up before an NFL football game against the Baltimore Ravens in Baltimore, Sunday, Dec. 31, 2023. (AP Photo/Matt Rourke)

The Miami Dolphins were playing out the final minutes of a particularly distasteful defeat Sunday when things went from bad to worse.

The first-string defense had already been humbled and beaten by the Baltimore Ravens when star linebacker Bradley Chubb dropped to the ground, flat on his back and unable to move because of a knee injury. A while later, the team’s sack leader was lifted onto a cart and driven into the tunnel.

Dolphins coach Mike McDaniel lamented his decision to keep Chubb on the field in the waning minutes of what became a 56-19 loss.

“In hindsight, I would have absolutely not wanted him out there if I knew he was going to get hurt, for sure,” McDaniel said. “That’s a known part of the job that I understand fully. It doesn’t look very smart at all.”

While it appears unlikely that the sixth-year pro will return to play this season, McDaniel grimaced and held out hope for a favorable diagnosis.

“We don’t have the information to find out what it is yet. We’ll be able to find out (Monday),” McDaniel said.

All in all, it was a horrible day for a team intent on upsetting the Ravens and earning the top seed in the AFC.

“We came into this game with high hopes of playing to the standard we wanted to play,” quarterback Tua Tagovailoa said. “When those standards aren’t met, it’s very disappointing.”

The Dolphins fell behind by 22 points early in the third quarter, and a harried Tagovailoa couldn’t make up the deficit in a lopsided setback that prevented Miami (11-5) from clinching the AFC East.

In a matchup between the teams with the two best records in the conference, Baltimore (13-3) dominated the Dolphins to earn a first-round bye and the opportunity to play every game at home in the postseason leading up to the Super Bowl.

If Miami can’t beat visiting Buffalo next week, the Bills would win the AFC East title and the Dolphins would start the playoffs on the road.

Miami led 10-7 before the Ravens went on a 28-3 run bridging the second and third quarters. Last year, Tagovailoa rallied Miami from a 35-14 hole to a 42-38 victory.

But this Baltimore team would have none of that. Not only did the Ravens pick off two passes and finish with three sacks, but Baltimore quarterback Lamar Jackson ripped apart the Miami defense for 321 yards passing and five touchdowns.

Miami could still end up with the No. 2 seed in the AFC if it beats Buffalo. The Dolphins haven’t finished atop the division since 2008 and have gone more than three decades without securing a top-two seed.

But they’ll likely have to do it without Chubb, who has 11 sacks to go with 74 tackles, including six on Sunday before the injury.

“I want to say a big shout-out to Bradley Chubb,” Tagovailoa said. “We’re thinking of you, brother, and we’re praying for you as well. It’s tough seeing one of our guys go down like that. It’s unfortunate.”

Miami’s top-ranked offense was without standout wide receiver Jaylen Waddle and workhorse running back Raheem Mostert, both of whom were inactive with injuries. Waddle ranks second on the team with 72 catches and 1,014 yards receiving, and last year he had 11 receptions for 171 yards and two TDs in Miami’s win at Baltimore.

Tyreek Hill had six catches for 76 yards, but he also dropped a certain touchdown in the back of the end zone.

“I played probably one of the worst games of my career,” Hill said. “As a leader of this team, just got to erase it and move forward.”

In last year’s game between these teams, the Ravens took a 35-14 lead into the fourth quarter. In this one, it was 35-13 before a touchdown pass from Tagovailoa to rookie running back De’Von Achane with 13:57 left gave Miami hope of mounting another rally.

But Baltimore subsequently rumbled 75 yards in seven plays to make it 42-19 with 9:38 remaining.

Tagovailoa was removed with just over four minutes remaining with a sore shoulder that he insisted was not an issue. At that point, it was pretty much time for the Dolphins to turn their attention toward the finale against Buffalo, a rematch of a game the Bills won 48-20 at home in October.

Except the defense remained on the field, and Chubb paid the price for playing during garbage time.

keywords.name: Miami Dolphins head coach Mike McDaniel

summary: The Miami Dolphins suffered a 56-19 loss to the Baltimore Ravens, with star linebacker Bradley Chubb unable to move due to a knee injury. Dolphins coach Mike McDaniel expressed regret over keeping Chubb on the field late in the game, which was already humiliating for the first-string defense. Chubb, who leads the team's sack leader, was carted away from the field with a cart following the injury. The loss prevented Miami from clinching the AFC East and potentially securing the No. 2 seed in the AFC if it defeats Buffalo next week. The Dolphins' top-ranked offense was without standout wide receiver Jaylen Waddle and running back Raheem Mostert.

title: Six killed in midnight fire in glove-making unit in Waluj
description: Six workers died in a major fire at Sunshine Enterprises, a Waluj industrial area-based manufacturing unit near Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar. The fire br
content: CHHATRAPATI SAMBHAJINAGAR: Six workers died in a major fire that broke out at Sunshine Enterprises , a Waluj industrial area-based glove and safety equipment manufacturing unit, near Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar , early on Sunday morning.The fire broke out sometime after 1am, and at the time, 17 people were sleeping on the premises of the family-owned factory.Eleven of them managed to make it out on time.Chief minister Eknath Shinde, expressing grief, has announced an ex gratia of Rs 5 lakh for the family members of the deceased workers and free treatment for people injured at the state-run hospital.Fire brigade officials in Waluj said they received the distress call at 1.20am, and they immediately sent their fire tenders to the factory. Fire tenders of the Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar Municipal Corporation and Bajaj Auto were rushed to the site.Rajesh Gharat, the MIDC Waluj fire officer, said the fire might have broken out earlier, but since people were sleeping, they came to know of it late. "The factory unit is a single-storey structure. By the time we reached the site, the factory and the margin area surrounding it, measuring around 5,000 sqft, was almost completely engulfed in the flames. There was thick smoke and intense heat emanating from all sides of the factory. We managed to get in and found six bodies," he said.Some of the people who were inside when the fire broke out used a staircase to get out before the flames could cut off their path. A few others, who could not use the staircase, went to the roof and, using a tree nearby, climbed out,” he said. The deceased were identified as Mohammed Mushtaq Mohammed Ibrahim (32), Kushar Aalam Jafiroddin (37), Mohammed Iqbal Mohammed Ehrar (17), Lallan Singh (60), Shaikh Riyaz (32) — all from Madhubani district of Bihar — and Mohammed Margab Alamjita Saduddin (32), from the Badnapur taluka of Jalna district of Marathwada. Ganesh Tathe, MIDC Waluj police station’s inspector, said acontractor and his two children are among the 11 who managed to get out on time.“A total of 17 people, including workers, contractor and their family members were trapped inside. Of them, six succumbed to smoke and heat. The workers’ bodies were sent for a postmortem examination after identification,” he said, adding those who escaped do not have major injuries. Police and fire department officials said the exact cause of the fire could not be ascertained immediately. The MIDC Waluj police have booked two people — labour contractor Mohammed Hasinoddin Shaikh, who too is from Bihar, and factory owner Saber Khan Shabbir Khan Pathan, a resident of the Baijipura area.The police have invoked IPC sections 304 (punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder), 285 (negligent conduct with respect to fire or combustible matter) and 34 (criminal act done by several persons in furtherance of the common intention of all). The Sunshine Enterprises management and authorities could not be reached for their comments on the mobile phone numbers displayed on the firm’s website.

keywords.name: factory owner Saber Khan Shabbir Khan Pathan

summary: A major fire broke out at Sunshine Enterprises, a glove and safety equipment manufacturing unit in Waluj, shortly after 1am on Sunday. The fire was discovered by fire department officials at the family-owned factory, where 17 people were sleeping. Eleven people made it out of the building on time, but six of them succumbed to smoke and heat. Chief Minister Eknath Shinde has announced an ex gratia of Rs 5 lakh for the deceased workers' family and free treatment for those injured at a state-run hospital. The cause of the fire was not immediately known. Two people have been booked in connection with the incident. The police have invoked IPC sections 304 (culpable homicide), 285 (negligent conduct with respect to fire or combustible matter), and 34 (criminal act done by several persons in furtherance of all).

title: 'Our community will reel from the pain': Tributes to loving dad killed in highway crash
description: The father has been remembered as a loving family man.
content:
David Drozd was driving to Dubbo with his wife and five of their children when their Kia Carnival was hit in the chaos following a head-on collision at Wallerawang on Friday, December 29. The driver of another vehicle, Jason McMahon from Narellan Vale, was also killed.

"He has left a legacy of a family who is full of so much love and support for one another, it's beautiful to see," Anita Peeters said on Facebook.

Ryan Connellan said that Mr Drozd was a "faithful member of Central Mountains Baptist Church". "He and his family would often attend conferences at my church. He was a lovely man who dearly loved the Lord and his family of nine children."

Mr Connellan said Mr Drozd and his family were on their way to Dubbo for the gender reveal of their first grandchild.

"Our community will reel from the pain of this news. In the Blue Mountains we are very tight knit and the shock of this will affect so many," he told ACM.

"Life is so fragile and the most important parts of it are those we know and those we love.

"Our whole community will hold David and everyone who knew and loved him close to our hearts at this most awful time."

Posting on social media, Lithgow mayor Maree Statham extended her sincere sympathies to the "families and friends for the tragic loss of their loved ones" in the horror crash.

"To the remaining injured, including the beautiful children, our sincere concerns for your recovery, we have incredible specialists and medical staff in our hospitals that no doubt will fight the fight of their lives to do what they can to save these very badly injured patients."

Five vehicles were involved in the crash on the Great Western Highway, which happened just before 1pm, with injured passengers taken to Westmead Hospital and Westmead Children's Hospital.
summary: David Drozd was killed in a head-on collision on the Great Western Highway in the Blue Mountains on December 29, along with his wife and five children. The driver of another vehicle, Jason McMahon, was also killed. The crash occurred at Wallerawang, with five vehicles involved. The family was headed to Dubbo for the gender reveal of their first grandchild. Ryan Connellan, a member of Central Mountains Baptist Church, expressed the community's grief over the loss of Drozzd. Lithgow mayor Maree Statham expressed her support for the injured, including the children, and medical staff in hospitals.

title: Weather In Monterrey: The Cold Is Coming This Sunday, From What Time?
description: Written by LOCAL on 12/31/2023 · 08:36 hs
content:
Monterrey.- The city of Monterrey woke up on Sunday, December 31, 2023, with a cool atmosphere and sunny skies.

In the morning this condition is expected to continue and there will be a pleasant atmosphere with a temperature of 16 degrees.

At 12:00 pm, the temperature is expected to be 20 degrees Celsius, and the sun will remain in the metropolitan area of ​​Monterrey, accompanied by cold.

Starting at 4:00 pm, the temperature will reach the highest point of 23 degrees, while the city of Monterrey will be under cloudy skies for the citizens.

At 9:00 pm, good weather is expected with a temperature of 17 degrees Celsius. The minimum for this last Sunday of the year is estimated to be 10 degrees Celsius.

The weather forecast extends from January 1 to January 3, 2024 in Monterrey.

On Monday, January 1, a maximum temperature of 21 degrees and a minimum of 13 degrees Celsius is expected, and there will be cloudy skies.

For Tuesday, a temperature similar to the previous ones is expected, with a maximum of 17 and a minimum of 12 degrees Celsius, with no possibility of rain in the metropolitan area of ​​Monterrey.

On Wednesday there will be a maximum of 20 and a minimum of 11 degrees Celsius for the citizens of Monterrey.

With information from The Weather Channel and Civil Protection

Recommendations from the Civil Protection of Nuevo León to protect you from the cold

Appropriate clothing: Wear layers of clothing to stay warm. Wear thermal clothing, coats, gloves, scarves and hats to protect yourself from the cold.

Stay hydrated: Even if you’re not as thirsty as you feel in the heat, it’s important to drink enough water to stay hydrated.

Balanced diet: Eat warm, nutritious foods to raise your body temperature. Soups, stews, and hot drinks are good choices.

Safe heating: If you use home heating, make sure the systems are in good condition to avoid safety problems.

Protect your skin: The cold can dry out your skin, so use moisturizers to keep it soft and healthy.
summary: The weather forecast for Monterrey, Mexico, is set to change on Sunday, December 31, 2023, with a cool atmosphere and sunny skies expected. The temperature is expected to reach a maximum of 20 degrees Celsius at 12:00pm, while the city will remain cloudy. Starting at 4:00 pm, the temperature will reach a high point of 23 degrees. The Civil Protection of Nuevo León has issued recommendations for protection against the cold, including clothing, coats, gloves, and scarves to protect yourself from the cold. The cold can dry out skin, so use moisturizers to keep it soft and healthy.

title: Novel Approach: The Role of Drones and K9 Units in Law Enforcement
description: - ISP Today
content:
Law enforcement agencies are constantly seeking innovative methods to improve public safety. In recent years, the integration of cutting-edge technology, such as drones, and the reliable skills of K9 units have proven to be invaluable assets in criminal investigations. A recent incident in Telford highlights the successful collaboration between these two resources in apprehending a rape suspect.

The utilization of drones in law enforcement has revolutionized surveillance and search operations. Equipped with high-definition cameras, these unmanned aerial vehicles provide an unobstructed view of the surroundings, enabling officers to monitor potentially dangerous situations from a safe distance. In the case of the Telford rape suspect, the drone’s aerial perspective provided real-time footage to law enforcement, facilitating their swift response and ensuring the safety of officers and the community.

K9 units, on the other hand, have long been recognized for their exceptional olfactory capabilities. These highly trained dogs are able to detect various scents, making them invaluable in searching for missing persons, drugs, or evidence. In the Telford incident, the K9 unit played a crucial role in tracking down the suspect. Their acute sense of smell guided officers through challenging terrain, ultimately leading to the successful capture of the individual.

By combining the aerial advantage of drones with the sensory skills of K9 units, law enforcement agencies are able to cover more ground efficiently and effectively. This innovative approach improves response times, enhances officer safety, and increases the likelihood of apprehending suspects. It is a testament to the adaptability of law enforcement in integrating technological advancements and traditional investigative techniques.

As technology continues to evolve, it is crucial for law enforcement to embrace these advancements and harness their potential. The successful partnership between drones and K9 units exemplifies the effectiveness of integrating emerging technologies with established methods. By exploring new avenues and adopting a holistic approach, law enforcement agencies can continue to stay ahead in the ever-changing landscape of criminal investigations.

Q: How do drones aid law enforcement in criminal investigations?

 A: Drones equipped with high-definition cameras provide real-time footage of potentially dangerous situations, allowing officers to monitor from a safe distance.

Q: What are K9 units?

 A: K9 units consist of highly trained dogs with exceptional olfactory capabilities, used for searching for missing persons, drugs, or evidence.

Q: How do K9 units assist in apprehending suspects?

 A: K9 units use their acute sense of smell to track down suspects, guiding officers through challenging terrain.

Q: What are the benefits of combining drones and K9 units?

 A: This combination allows law enforcement agencies to cover more ground efficiently and effectively, improving response times and increasing the likelihood of capturing suspects.

Q: Why is it important for law enforcement to embrace new technology?

 A: Embracing new technology allows law enforcement agencies to stay ahead in criminal investigations and enhance their effectiveness.

1. Drones: Unmanned aerial vehicles equipped with cameras used for surveillance and search operations.

 2. K9 units: Specialized units comprised of highly trained dogs used for various purposes such as searching for missing persons or detecting drugs.
summary: The role of drones and K9 units in law enforcement has been highlighted in a recent incident in Telford where a rape suspect was apprehended. Drones, equipped with high-definition cameras, provide real-time footage of potentially dangerous situations and assist in apprehending suspects. These dogs, trained for their unique olfactory capabilities, can assist in finding missing persons, drugs, or evidence. This innovative approach improves response times, enhances officer safety, and increases the likelihood of apprehending criminals. The successful partnership between drones and these resources exemplifies the effectiveness of integrating emerging technologies with established methods. Embracing new technology allows law enforcement agencies to stay ahead in criminal investigations and enhance their effectiveness.

title: Mackenzie Holmes scores 30 as No. 16 Indiana women’s basketball turns back Illinois 77-71
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind. — Mackenzie Holmes scored 13 of her 30 points in the fourth quarter, Yarden Garzon was clutch in the closing seconds and No. 16 Indiana ran
content:
BLOOMINGTON, Ind. — Mackenzie Holmes scored 13 of her 30 points in the fourth quarter, Yarden Garzon was clutch in the closing seconds and No. 16 Indiana ran its winning streak to 10 with a 77-71 win over Illinois on Sunday.

Although the Hoosiers never trailed in the fourth quarter, it became a battle between Holmes and Makira Cook of the Illini. Holmes made a basket, the first of a nine-point run, that made it 61-58. Cook had seven straight points for Illinois and her two free throws with 55.1 seconds to go made it 68-67.

That’s when Chloe Moore-McNeil drove the lane and then found Garzon in the right corner for a 3-pointer. After an Illinois miss, Garzon made two free throws with 20.6 seconds left. Sara Scalia and Moore-McNeil both made a pair of free throws in the last 5.7 seconds to close out the Hoosiers’ 15th-straight victory over Illinois.

Moore-McNeil scored 19 points for Indiana (11-1, 2-0 Big Ten Conference) and Garzon had 12. Holmes gave the Hoosiers a 30-point scorer for the third straight game, a first in program history. Garzon (30) and Scalia (32) started the string. Holmes was 10 of 14 from the field and 10 of 12 from the foul line.

Cook scored 24 points for the Illini (6-6, 0-2), 13 in the fourth quarter. Kendall Bostic scored 18 with 11 rebounds and Genesis Bryant added 12 points.

Indiana went 7 of 12 from the field, including 3 of 4 from 3-point range, and 11 of 13 from the line in the fourth quarter. Illinois was 9 of 17, 1 of 2 from distance, and 5 of 7 from the line.

Holmes had 15 points, missing just two of her eight shots, and Moore-McNeil 10 as the Hoosiers took a 37-31 lead at the half.

A 9-0 run, with Moore-McNeil making a layup and a 3-pointer, gave Indiana the lead for good at 13-6. It was 17-10 after one quarter.

Moore-McNeil made consecutive layups as an Indiana 9-0 run made it 46-35 in the third quarter. A Cook jumper capped a 10-0 Illinois surge that made it 48-47 before Indiana took a 49-47 lead into the fourth quarter.

Indiana has a home game against Michigan on Thursday. Illinois is off until next Sunday when Wisconsin visits.
summary: No. 16 Indiana women's basketball defeated Illinois 77-71, marking the team's 15th consecutive victory over the Illini. Mackenzie Holmes scored 13 of her 30 points in the fourth quarter, while Yarden Garzon made two free throws in the final seconds to secure the win. Chloe Moore-McNeil and Garzon scored 19 points for Indiana, while Makira Cook scored 24 points for Illinois. The victory marks the third consecutive 30-point scorer in program history for the Hoosiers.

title: Bills survive Patriots 27-21, earn 4th straight win
description: ORCHARD PARK, N.Y. (WROC) — With an opportunity to clinch a playoff spot in a fifth consecutive season, the Bills did not begin the afternoon against the Patriots ideally. Rasul Douglas personally …
content:
ORCHARD PARK, N.Y. (WROC) — With an opportunity to clinch a playoff spot in a fifth consecutive season, the Bills did not begin the afternoon against the Patriots ideally.

Rasul Douglas personally made sure the rest of the game went ok.

Jalen Reagor returned the opening kickoff 98 yards for a touchdown to give the Patriots an immediate 7-0 lead. Josh Allen even took a sack and fumbled on the next play.

Douglas deflected a pass on the next Patriots drive and Ed Oliver made an incredible diving interception to set up a field goal. After a Buffalo punt, Douglas picked off Bailey Zappe himself for his third interception with the Bills.

Buffalo kept the ball on the ground after the turnover and needed four plays to go 14 yards for a go ahead touchdown. Josh Allen snuck the ball in from a yard out to finish the short field drive and give the Bills their first lead.

Christian Benford punched a ball out on the next Patriots drive and recovered the ball himself. That led to a second Tyler Bass field goal.

Douglas struck again in early in the second quarter. The Bills sent an all-out blitz on a third and 11. Zappe tried a short, quick throw to avoid the blitz. His receiver went deep. Douglas did not. After a diving interception, Douglas returned the ball 40 yards for his first Bills touchdown. It’s already his second two interception game. Buffalo had a 20-7 lead.

It didn’t last long. A 48 yard Kevin Harris catch and run on a great screen pass got the Patriots into the red zone. Zappe strolled in with a 17 yard scramble for a touchdown on the next snap and New England was back within a score. It remained a 20-14 game at the half.

Buffalo restored some space with a strong drive to open the second half. Dalton Kincaid beat Kyle Duggar off the line and got free for a 51 yard connection. James Cook and Allen combined for five rushes and 13 yards that finished the drive. The Bills version of the Tush Push finally pushed the ball over the goal line for a 27-14 lead.

After an exchange of punts, Zappe hit Reagor with a 39 yard pass that got the Patriots to the Bills 30 yard line. A Demario Douglas catch and run moved the ball inside the red zone and Jordan Poyer tacked on seven more with a ridiculous late hit. Ezekiel Elliott scored on the next play from six yards out and the Patriots had, once again, closed within a score.

On the next possession, the Bills were unable to put point on the board after an Allen fumble on 3rd down near midfield forced them to punt. However, a fabulous punt by Sam Martin pinned the Patriots inside the five yard line.

The Buffalo defense forced a three and out and the offense was able to run the final five minutes of the game off the clock to secure the win.

Allen completed 15 of his 30 passing attempts for 169 passing yards to go along with an interception and two rushing touchdowns. Cook led the ground attack with 48 yards on 16 carries.

Kincaid had a game-high 47 receiving yards on four catches while Khalil Shakir had 39 receiving yards.

The Bills (10-6) will take on the Dolphins (11-5) next weekend where the winner will be crowned the AFC East champs.

entities.data: the Tush Push finally pushed the ball over the goal line for a 27-14 lead.

summary: The Buffalo Bills beat the Patriots 27-21, securing their fourth consecutive win in a row to secure a playoff spot for the fifth consecutive season. The game was not an ideal start for the Patriots, with Jalen Reagor returning the opening kickoff 98 yards for a touchdown and giving the Patriots an early 7-0 lead. Rasul Douglas made a key defensive play, including an interception by Bailey Zappe himself and a field goal by Ed Oliver. The Bills managed to recover from a turnover and score a 14-yard touchdown to score 27-14. Despite a strong drive from the Patriots in the second half, Buffalo restored some space with a strong offensive drive. The win moves the Bills to face the Dolphins next weekend, where the winner will be crowned AFC East champs.

title: Incident at Erbil Airport: Armed Drone Shot Down, No Casualties Reported
description: - ISP Today
content:
In a recent development at Erbil airport in northern Iraq, an armed drone was successfully shot down by defense systems, according to a statement by Iraqi Kurdistan’s counter-terrorism service. This incident took place where various international forces, including the United States, are stationed. The drone was launched by a group calling themselves the “Islamic Resistance in Iraq” with the intention of targeting what they referred to as an “occupation base.” Fortunately, no casualties or damages to infrastructure were reported.

The security concerns in the region have been heightened recently due to the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas. This has led to increased vigilance among U.S. and international forces based in Iraq and neighboring Syria. These forces have been faced with numerous attacks on their bases in recent weeks.

Interestingly, this incident occurred less than a day after two other drones were shot down near a northern Iraqi military base utilized by the Iraqi Kurdish Peshmerga forces, as well as the al-Harir airbase that houses U.S. forces. The Kurdish Regional Government confirmed these earlier drone attacks.

In response to Saturday’s attack, Iraqi Prime Minister Mohammed al-Sudani has ordered a thorough investigation in collaboration with the Kurdish regional security forces. The prime minister’s military spokesman stated that they are determined to pursue those responsible for the attack.

Efforts to enhance security measures in the area continue, as authorities strive to safeguard the well-being of the international forces stationed in Iraq. The incident serves as a reminder of the ongoing challenges present in the region, and the importance of maintaining vigilance and preparedness to ensure the safety of all.

Q: What happened at Erbil airport in northern Iraq?

 A: An armed drone was shot down by defense systems at Erbil airport.

Q: Who shot down the drone?

 A: The drone was shot down by defense systems operated by Iraqi Kurdistan’s counter-terrorism service.

Q: Who launched the drone?

 A: The drone was launched by a group called the “Islamic Resistance in Iraq.”

Q: What was the intention of launching the drone?

 A: The group intended to target what they referred to as an “occupation base.”

Q: Were there any casualties or damages?

 A: No casualties or damages to infrastructure were reported.

Q: Why are security concerns heightened in the region?

 A: The ongoing conflict between Israel and Hamas has led to increased vigilance among U.S. and international forces based in Iraq and neighboring Syria.

Q: Have there been other drone attacks recently?

 A: Yes, two other drones were shot down near a northern Iraqi military base and the al-Harir airbase prior to this incident.

Q: What actions are being taken in response to the attack?

 A: Iraqi Prime Minister Mohammed al-Sudani has ordered a thorough investigation in collaboration with the Kurdish regional security forces to pursue those responsible for the attack.

Q: What is the importance of enhancing security measures in the area?

 A: The incident serves as a reminder of the ongoing challenges present in the region and highlights the importance of maintaining vigilance and preparedness to ensure the safety of the international forces stationed in Iraq.

– Erbil airport: The international airport located in Erbil, the capital city of the Kurdistan Region in Iraq.

– Iraqi Kurdistan’s counter-terrorism service: The security agency responsible for counterterrorism efforts in the Kurdistan Region of Iraq.

– Islamic Resistance in Iraq: A group that launched the armed drone attack. They refer to their targets as “occupation bases.”

– Kurdish Peshmerga forces: The military forces of the Kurdistan Regional Government in Iraq.

– al-Harir airbase: A military base in northern Iraq which houses U.S. forces.
summary: A drone was successfully shot down at Erbil airport in northern Iraq, where international forces, including the United States, are stationed. The drone was launched by a group calling themselves the “Islamic Resistance in Iraq” with the intention of targeting an “occupation base.” No casualties or damages to infrastructure were reported. The incident occurred less than a day after two other drones were shot down near a northern Iraqi military base used by the Iraqi Kurdish Peshmerga forces and the al-Harir airbase that houses U.S. forces. In response to the attack, Iraqi Prime Minister Mohammed al-Sudani has ordered a thorough investigation into the perpetrators. Efforts to enhance security measures in the area continue as authorities strive to safeguard the safety of international forces stationed in Iraq.
