title:
18 lakh rupees hidden in a bank locker for daughter’s marriage were eaten by termites

 GeoTv News
description: 18 lakh rupees hidden in a bank locker for daughter's marriage were eaten by termites GeoTv News
content:
A unique case was discovered in UP’s Moradabad. The client’s money was kept in a locker at the Bank of Baroda branch, but he was completely shocked when he thought of withdrawing the money after a few months. Namely, the mentioned person kept 18,000,000 rupees in cash a long time ago, which were eaten by termites. As he opened his locker, he was in disbelief and panicked. Many of the bills in the cash and jewelry lockers turned to dust, eaten by termites. The woman informed the manager of the branch and that’s when the investigation began.

Since the notes have been recorded

According to media reports, a woman named Alka Pathak, who lives in Ashiana, Moradabad, kept cash of Rs 18 lakh along with jewelery for her younger daughter’s wedding. The woman is said to have deposited this amount at the Ramganga Vihar branch in October last year. Last Monday, the woman came to do the KYC and in the meantime she opened her locker to check. Then he saw that Siunk had made a powder from the notes. He then informed the bank about it. According to the woman, she saved the money she received from the guests at her elder daughter’s wedding. In addition, he saved money by teaching business and tutoring, to whom he wanted to marry his younger daughter.

The woman didn’t know the rules

When asked about this, the woman said that she did not know whether money could be kept in the locker or not, nor did she know about it. She didn’t read anywhere that she could keep money in a locker. In addition, when the bank received information about this, the branch manager said that the case is now being investigated. The report was prepared and sent. As soon as the report arrives, further action will be taken accordingly and information provided.

On the other hand, sisters who came ‘to the market’ to buy Rakhi for their brothers say that this year like every year they are very excited about Rakhi bandhan. In addition to this, they say that the brandy with Moosewala’s photo is for their brothers this time
summary: A unique case was discovered in UP's Moradabad, where 18,000,000 rupees hidden in a bank locker for daughter's marriage were eaten by termites. The client, Alka Pathak, kept the money in a locker at the Bank of Baroda branch and was shocked when he opened the locker after a few months. Many bills in the cash and jewelry lockers turned to dust, eating them. The woman informed the branch manager and an investigation into the incident began. She had deposited the money at the Ramganga Vihar branch in October last year. The bank is now investigating the case.

title: Rituales de Año Nuevo: Con sahumerio y agua bendita santifica su negocio
description: Como parte de los rituales de Año Nuevo, un comerciante del mercado Pino Suárez utiliza sahumerio y agua bendita para santificar su negocio y pedir prosperidad para él y sus clientes
content:
A pocas horas de terminar el 2023, propietarios de negocios de diferentes giros realizan rituales para que les vaya mejor el próximo año.

Es el caso de José de Jesús Moreno Cortés, quien fabrica zapatos de piel, repara calzado y hace duplicados de llaves.

Sahumó su local ubicado dentro del mercado público José María Pino Suárez pidiendo a Dios un 2024 con mucha salud, trabajo y prosperidad.

"Dios bendice nuestro trabajo, a nuestros clientes, gracias a mi Dios nuestro señor, porque este año que comienza nos bendiga con salud, con trabajo, para que mi familia, mis amigos y compañeros tengamos esa prosperidad que anhelamos", expresó al pasar el sahumerio por su establecimiento.

#BuenaVibra #AñoNuevo

"Para que todo esté bien el año que viene. Hay que seguir chambeando con la bendición de Dios", enfatizó.

title: Coyote vs. ACME: See First Photo From the Shelved Warner Bros. Movie Now Seeking a Streaming Home
description: Neither Wile E. Coyote nor lawyer Will Forte look at all confident about their case in a first photo from Coyote vs. ACME, the live-action/animation hybrid film that Warner Bros. recently decided t…
content:
Neither Wile E. Coyote nor lawyer Will Forte look at all confident about their case in a first photo from Coyote vs. ACME, the live-action/animation hybrid film that Warner Bros. recently decided to shelve, and as such now is seeking a streaming home.

Veteran voice actor Eric Bauza, who plays Wile E., shared the first-look photo on Sunday via X (fka Twitter/how much longer do we have to keep making that delineation for everyone?).

Directed by Dave Green (Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows) and written by Samy Burch (May December) from a story by Burch, now-DC Studios co-CEO James Gunn (Peacemaker) and Jeremy Slater (The Umbrella Academy), Coyote vs. Acme comedically details what happens when the plaintiff, whose infamous pursuit of the Road Runner has many, many a time been waylaid by defective (and often very explosive) ACME products, hires Forte’s character to sue the conglomerate.

John Cena (Peacemaker) plays the lead attorney for ACME, who is the former boss of Forte’s character. Other cast members include Lana Condor (To All the Boys I Loved Before) and P.J. Byrne (The Boys).

As reported in early November, Warner Bros. elected to shelve the produced film and instead take a $30 million tax write-down, akin to what it did with the Batgirl movie in summer 2022. But almost immediately, there were cries for someone, even a streaming service, to pony up enough bucks to make WB agree to forego the write-down.

A mid-November screening bolstered the chances of that happening, as the likes of Phil Lord and Christopher Miller (of The LEGO Movie and the Spider-Verse movies) sang its praises.

“I saw COYOTE VS ACME and it’s delightful,” Miller said on X. “Funny, charming, good physical comedy timing, with a surprising amount of heart. I hope several studios go after it so the world can see all the good work people did.” Added Lord: “Coyote vs. Acme is wonderful. @dgreenmachine nails it. Hilarious smart existential and moving and moves this all time character more relevant than ever.”

Actor/comedian Paul Scheer meanwhile opined on Threads, “Coyote vs. Acme might be the best version of the Looney Tunes on the Big Screen ever. @dgreenmachine & samyburch nailed it. It’s got jokes, it’s got heart and it’s got Will Forte. You can’t miss (also the deep pulls w/ cartoon cameos are A+).“

entities.data: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows
the Looney Tunes on the Big Screen

summary: The first photo from the live-action/animation hybrid film, Coyote vs. ACME, has been shared by voice actor Eric Bauza. The film, which Warner Bros. recently decided to shelve, is now seeking a streaming home and is directed by Dave Green and written by Samy Burch. The cast includes James Gunn, Lana Condor, and P.J. Byrne. There have been calls for a streaming service to contribute to the $30 million tax write-down, similar to what it did with the Batgirl movie in 2022.

title: Las funciones de iOS 17 que Apple lanzará en 2024
description: Vamos a detallarte las funciones de iOS 17 que veremos en 2024, para que puedas conocer las novedades que Apple lanzará en próximas versiones del sistema operativo.
content:
Vamos a detallarte las funciones de iOS 17 que veremos en 2024, para que puedas conocer las novedades que Apple lanzará en próximas versiones del sistema operativo. Aunque iOS 17 se lanzó en septiembre y hemos ido viendo poco a poco más funciones, todavía quedan unas cuantas por descubrir. Afortunadamente, ya conocemos la mayoría.

A lo largo de este artículo, vamos a contarte las novedades de iOS 17 que veremos en 2024, con especial protagonismo de las tiendas de aplicaciones de terceros o la compatibilidad de la app Mensajes con el protocolo RCS, dos de los mayores cambios que iOS experimentará en toda su historia. Veamos cuáles son esas funciones.

Las funciones de iOS 17 que veremos en 2024

Ya hemos explorado prácticamente todas las funciones de iOS 17; sin embargo, aún no las hemos visto por completo. Todavía quedan, que sepamos, unas seis novedades que veremos en 2024, además de las que añadan en la versión de primavera, que suele llegar con importantes novedades. Estas son todas las que conocemos:
• Tiendas de aplicaciones de terceros: Apple tiene hasta el 5 de marzo para permitir las tiendas de aplicaciones de terceros en iOS. Este cambio permitiría a los usuarios descargar aplicaciones fuera del App Store, como ya se hace en macOS. Un cambio al que Apple siempre se ha opuesto, pero que parece inevitable por el momento.
• Listas colaborativas de Apple Music: Una de las novedades que llegará primero con iOS 17.3. Es una función que permitirá a varios usuarios formar parte de una lista de reproducción y añadir o eliminar canciones. Lo curioso es que también permitirá reaccionar con emojis a las canciones añadidas, un detalle que podría esconder otras funciones.
• Asistencia en carretera vía satélite: Es una función que permitirá conectarte a un satélite para pedir ayuda en caso de tener un problema con tu coche y no tener cobertura. Por ahora, solo está disponible en Estados Unidos, pero llegará a más países en 2024.
• Nuevo modo antirrobo para el iPhone: Otra novedad que llegará junto a iOS 17.3 y las listas colaborativas es un nuevo modo que priorizará Face o Touch ID frente al código para realizar acciones sensibles del sistema, como cambiar la clave de Apple ID o acceder al llavero de iCloud.
• Compatibilidad con el protocolo RCS: Confirmada para una próxima versión de iOS, mejorará las conversaciones a través de mensajes entre iOS y Android. Es posible que llegue como parte de iOS 18, pero sí estará disponible en 2024.
• El nuevo CarPlay: Tras anunciar las primeras marcas de coches compatibles, queda por ver este nuevo sistema en acción. También lo veremos en 2024.

Hay que tener en cuenta que estas son las novedades que conocemos y que llegarán el próximo año. Sin embargo, Apple lanzará más novedades, sobre todo en la actualización de iOS de primavera. En años anteriores, hemos visto la compatibilidad del iPad con ratones o la posibilidad de desbloquear el iPhone con nuestro Apple Watch al llevar la mascarilla puesta.

Únete a nuestro canal de Telegram, información sin censura: https://t.me/canal800noticias
translation:
We are going to detail the functions of iOS 17 that we will see in 2024, so that you can learn about the new features that Apple will launch in future versions of the operating system. Although iOS 17 was released in September and we have been seeing more features little by little, there are still a few to discover. Fortunately, we already know most of them.

Throughout this article, we are going to tell you the news of iOS 17 that we will see in 2024, with special prominence of third-party application stores or the compatibility of the Messages app with the RCS protocol, two of the biggest changes that iOS will experience throughout its history. Let's see what those functions are.

The iOS 17 features that we will see in 2024

We've already explored pretty much every feature of iOS 17; However, we have not yet seen them completely. There are still, as far as we know, about six new features that we will see in 2024, in addition to those added in the spring version, which usually comes with important new features. These are all the ones we know:
• Third-party app stores: Apple has until March 5 to allow third-party app stores on iOS. This change would allow users to download applications outside of the App Store, as is already done on macOS. A change that Apple has always opposed, but that seems inevitable for the moment.
• Apple Music collaborative lists: One of the new features that will arrive first with iOS 17.3. It is a function that will allow several users to be part of a playlist and add or delete songs. The curious thing is that it will also allow you to react with emojis to the added songs, a detail that could hide other functions.
• Roadside assistance via satellite: It is a function that will allow you to connect to a satellite to ask for help if you have a problem with your car and do not have coverage. For now, it is only available in the United States, but will reach more countries in 2024.
• New anti-theft mode for the iPhone: Another novelty that will arrive with iOS 17.3 and collaborative lists is a new mode that will prioritize Face or Touch ID over the code to perform sensitive system actions, such as changing the Apple ID password or accessing the iCloud Keychain.
• Support for the RCS protocol: Confirmed for an upcoming version of iOS, it will improve conversations via messages between iOS and Android. It is possible that it will arrive as part of iOS 18, but it will be available in 2024.
• The new CarPlay: After announcing the first compatible car brands, it remains to be seen this new system in action. We will also see it in 2024.

It must be taken into account that these are the new features that we know and that will arrive next year. However, Apple will release more new features, especially in the spring iOS update. In previous years, we have seen the compatibility of the iPad with mice or the possibility of unlocking the iPhone with our Apple Watch while wearing the mask.

translated_description: We are going to detail the functions of iOS 17 that we will see in 2024, so that you can learn about the new features that Apple will launch in future versions of the operating system.
translated_summary: Apple's mobile operating system, iOS 17, was released in September and there are still several new features that will be introduced in 2024, including third-party application stores or compatibility of the Messages app with the RCS protocol. These features will allow users to download applications outside of the App Store, a change that Apple has always opposed, but it is expected to be implemented in the future. Other notable features include Apple Music collaborative lists, roadside assistance via satellite, new anti-theft mode for the iPhone, new Face or Touch ID mode for sensitive system actions, and support for the R CS protocol. The new CarPlay system, which has been announced by car brands, is also set to be released in 2024. However, Apple is known to be releasing more new features in the spring iOS update.

title: Sunday Night Football: Packers vs. Vikings score, highlights, news, inactives and live updates
description: The Vikings and Packers are both still in the NFC wild-card hunt.
content:
The NFC North is already claimed by the Detroit Lions.

But the Green Bay Packers and Minnesota Vikings are still alive in the NFC wild cart hunt at 7-8. The longtime rivals face off Sunday night with each team's playoff hopes on the line.

The loser of Sunday's game will all but be eliminated from the playoffs. The winner will remain in the postseason hunt in the final week of the regular season.

The Vikings won in Green Bay in Week 8 in the first game of the series. But that was with Kirk Cousins at quarterback. Now rookie Jaren Hall is starting for the Vikings as the series shifts to Minnesota. Can Jordan Love and the Packers return the favor of a road win?

Follow along with Yahoo Sports for highlights and updates from "Sunday Night Football."
summary: The Green Bay Packers and Minnesota Vikings are still alive in the NFC wild cart hunt at 7-8. The loser of Sunday's game will likely be eliminated from the playoffs. The winner will remain in the postseason hunt in the final week of the regular season. The Vikings won the first game of the series in Green Bay in Week 8, with Kirk Cousins starting for the Vikings. The series shifts to Minnesota, with the winner likely to return the favor of a road win.

title: Mavericks spoil New Year’s Eve for Coyotes
description: Omaha started the game on an 11-0 run that spurred them to a 67-51 win over South Dakota inside the Sanford Coyote Sports Center Sunday afternoon.
content: VERMILLION, S.D. – Omaha started the game on an 11-0 run that spurred them to a 67-51 win over South Dakota inside the Sanford Coyote Sports Center Sunday afternoon.Frankie Fidler was one of three Mavericks to score in double-figures with a game-high 27 points in helping Omaha (7-8, 1-1 Summit) to its first road win and league win of the season. He scored 15 of Omaha's first 23 points early in the first half and went 8-of-15 from the field in just over 38 minutes of play.led South Dakota (8-7, 1-1 Summit) with his third-straight double-double (seventh of the season) of 15 rebounds and 12 points.recorded his fourth-straight double-figure scoring game with 12 points.The Mavericks came out to a blistering 11-0 start, led by Fidler who went 2-of-3 from the field and 3-of-3 from the free throw line within the first minutes. Omaha held South Dakota scoreless until the 16-minute mark when one of Thioune's second-chance attempts finally fell through the net. Omaha responded with seven-straight unanswered points, with Fidler adding five more to get him to double-digits early in the first half.South Dakota started to recover from the slow start and had cut Omaha's lead down to seven at 26-19 with 6:34 to play before halftime. JJ White knocked down a triple to stop the Coyotes' momentum and shift it back in Omaha's favor. Stewart was blocked on a driving layup by Fidler which led to a fast break layup for Ja'Sean Glover to extend Omaha's lead back to double digits at 33-23. The Mavericks took a 39-25 lead into the halftime break.The Coyotes came out of the halftime break and held Omaha scoreless through the first two and half minutes. Fidler broke the scoreless draught with six quick points for the Mavericks. At just under 12 minutes to play in the second half, a breakaway layup for Glover extended Omaha's lead back to 20 at 54-34. The Coyotes scored six unanswered points but a triple from Biko Johnson iced the game and gave the Mavericks a 67-44 lead with two minutes to play.Omaha forced 13 Coyote turnovers and scored 14 points off those while also committing a season-low six turnovers. The Mavericks made it to the line 16 times and shot 87.5 percent while South Dakota shot 50 percent from the charity stripe.South Dakota won the rebounding battle 45-34, but the Mavericks outscored the Coyotes in the paint 32-22.The Coyotes stay home to host Eastern Washington on Wednesday as a part of the Big Sky-Summit Challenge. Tip-off is set for 7 p.m. inside the Sanford Coyote Sports Center.
summary: Omaha defeated South Dakota 67-51 on New Year's Eve, marking Omaha's first road win and league win of the season. Frankie Fidler was one of three Mavericks to score in double-figures, scoring a game-high 27 points. The Mavericks started the game on an 11-0 run and took a 39-25 lead into the halftime break. South Dakota's Biko Johnson scored a triple to give the Mavericks a 67-44 lead. Omaha forced 13 Coyote turnovers and scored 14 points off them, while South Dakota managed to win the rebounding battle 45-34. The Coyotes will next face Eastern Washington in the Big Sky-Summit Challenge.

title: Global oil diplomacy 2024: Abundant crude supplies offer Biden strategic leverage amidst potential election-year sanctions
description: Global oil diplomacy 2024: Abundant crude supplies offer Biden strategic leverage amidst potential election-year sanctions New Delhi, December 30 I...
content:
n the complex landscape of global oil supplies, the Biden administration faces strategic decisions regarding potential oil-related sanctions on Russia, Iran, and Venezuela in 2024.

As per S&P Global, while US gasoline prices hold significance in an election year, experts suggest that increased global oil supplies, driven in part by enhanced US oil production, provide the administration with some flexibility in its approach to geopolitical challenges.

Rachel Ziemba, an adjunct fellow at the Center for a New American Security, notes that the surge in global oil supplies, coupled with favourable market conditions, eases the risk associated with tighter sanctions.

Ziemba said, “Increased US oil production has boosted global supplies, which has reduced — but not eliminated — the risk from tighter sanctions. If easy oil conditions persist, in line with sluggish growth, I do think they may make it easier to continue with enforcement”.

The reduction in oil prices and concerns over macro risks empower Washington to navigate potential sanctions-related disruptions without triggering substantial price spikes.

As the year concludes, New York Mercantile Exchange (NYMEX) West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude prices show a 5 per cent decrease from the previous year, signalling a global supply surplus in early 2024.

Non-OPEC (Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries) supply growth is anticipated to outpace slowing global demand growth, leading to an implied liquids surplus of 2.2 million barrels per day in the first quarter, even with OPEC+ voluntary production cuts.

Global inventories have risen, and projections suggest accelerated builds in early 2024, peaking around May with an additional 150 million barrels before a resumption of draws.

This burgeoning supply surplus has contributed to a deep contango structure in crude forward curves, emphasizing the current market conditions.

Despite the focus on sanctions, other factors such as regional conflicts, OPEC+ decisions, US and Chinese demand, and disruptions in major shipping routes are expected to play a more crucial role in determining global oil supplies.

Brenda Shaffer, an energy expert at the US Naval Postgraduate School, highlights the impact of disruptions in major waterways, affecting shipping and insurance prices and adding a new premium to oil and LNG prices.

Brenda Shaffer, an energy expert at the US Naval Postgraduate School, said, “Disruptions in the world’s major waterways are affecting shipping prices and insurance prices and have built in a new premium in oil and LNG pricesAddressing waterway security more directly could add jitters to the global oil price”.

“With this in the background and in an election year, it is not likely that the Biden administration will enforce sanctions and undertake policies that will take oil barrels off the market,” she said.

While some experts foresee leeway for Washington on sanctions, others caution that risks from these factors may limit the administration’s options.

The ongoing disruptions in major waterways, coupled with the backdrop of an election year, may deter the Biden administration from implementing sanctions that could potentially impact oil barrels in the market.

Fernando Ferreira, director of geopolitical risk service at Rapidan Energy Group, emphasizes that Washington’s immediate oil sanctions focus is on Russia, anticipating a significant ramp-up in enforcement in the coming year.

Fernando Ferreira, director of geopolitical risk service at Rapidan Energy Group said, “Oil prices have come down quite a bit and most analysts seem to be concerned with further macro risks, so Washington can risk some sanctions-related disruptions without worrying too much about a price spike. Current market conditions give the administration more wiggle room to act.”

However, experts suggest that enforcing sanctions on Iran may not see significant changes unless there is an escalation in the Gaza/Israel conflict.

In Venezuela, where the US eased oil and mining sanctions for six months in exchange for progress toward fair elections in 2024, the Biden administration is expected to defer to the Venezuelan opposition’s assessment.

The flexibility in negotiations is essential, with a cautious approach to reimposing sanctions that could undermine humanitarian issues.

As the geopolitical landscape evolves, the Biden administration navigates the delicate balance between leveraging oil-related sanctions and ensuring stable global oil supplies in a year marked by elections and complex international dynamics.

Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries

summary: The Biden administration is facing decisions regarding potential oil-related sanctions on Russia, Iran, and Venezuela in 2024. Experts suggest that increased global oil supplies, driven in part by enhanced US oil production, provide flexibility in the administration's approach to geopolitical challenges. Rachel Ziemba, an adjunct fellow fellow at the Center for a New American Security, noted that this increased risk was reduced due to favourable market conditions. The reduction in oil prices and concerns over macro risks enable Washington to navigate potential sanctions-related disruptions without significant price spikes. However, experts also noted that other factors such as regional conflicts, OPEC+ decisions, US and Chinese demand, and disruptions in major shipping routes are expected to play a significant role in global oil supply.

title: Randeep Hooda, Lin Laishram head for first New Year vacation post marriage
description: Randeep Hooda, Lin Laishram head for first New Year vacation post marriage Mumbai, December 30 n new year is around the corner, and our B-town cele...
content:
Randeep Hooda, Lin Laishram head for first New Year vacation post marriage

new year is around the corner, and our B-town celebrities have started heading to different locations to celebrate New Year's Eve in a special way.

Newlyweds Randeep Hooda and Lin Laishram have also left Mumbai to celebrate their first New Year post marriage at a special place.

On Saturday morning, the duo was spotted at the Mumbai airport. They were all smiles as they posed for the paps.

Randeep was dressed in a plain off-white shirt and pants. Lin also kept her airport outfit comfortable yet stylish. Lin wore a pastel green shirt that she paired with a white crop top and white pants.

Randeep and Lin exchanged vows on November 29 in Manipur. Their wedding was performed in traditional Meitei rituals.

Notably, Lin made her Bollywood debut in 2007 with the film 'Om Shanti Om' in which she gave a cameo appearance as Om Kapoor's friend. She has appeared in other Bollywood films including Mary Kom (2014) as Bem, Umrika (2015) as Udai's wife, Rangoon (2017) as Mema, Qaidi Band (2017), and Axone (2019) as Chanbi.

Randeep, on the other hand, made his debut with 'Monsoon Wedding', got a lot of popularity with films such as 'Once Upon a Time in Mumbaai', 'Saheb, Biwi Aur Gangster', 'Rang Rasiya', 'Jism 2 ' and many more.

The duo reportedly fell in love during their theater days.

title: Whatever one thinks of him, David Warner has been fantastic for Australian cricket, says Greg Chappell
description: Whatever one thinks of him, David Warner has been fantastic for Australian cricket, says Greg Chappell Sydney, Dec 30 W ith David Warner all set to...
content:
Whatever one thinks of him, David Warner has been fantastic for Australian cricket, says Greg Chappell

ith David Warner all set to play his final Test match when Australia face Pakistan at Sydney on January 3, former cricketer Greg Chappell has heaped praise on his career in the longer format, saying irrespective of what one thinks of him, the left-handed batter has been fantastic.

“Whatever one thinks of him, David Warner has been fantastic for Australian cricket. The passion, energy, professionalism and competitiveness that he has bought to every contest have been unmatched.”

“He must accept that he has allowed himself to be portrayed in a certain manner. No human being could please all of the people all of the time, and it is therefore unrealistic to expect someone in the public eye (and, in your face) for more than 14 years, to do that.”

“I know how hard it is to do what he has done through 111 Tests, so I hope that David’s harshest critics acknowledge his talent and contribution and forgive his human frailties. Martin Luther King said: “Forgiveness is not an occasional act; it is a constant attitude”. I hope Sydney farewells David Warner fondly next week,” wrote Chappell in his column for ‘The Sydney Morning Herald’ on Saturday.

In 111 Tests since his debut in 2011, Warner has scored 8695 runs at an average of 44.6, including 26 fifties and 36 half-centuries, proving to snatch the game away from the opposition in quick time. Chappell also wrote on what make Warner click as a Test opener.

“Warner was such a brilliant player at the top of the order because he could take the game away from the opposition in a session, as he often did. A century before lunch against Pakistan at the SCG in 2017 comes readily to mind. It came off 78 balls and, in the process, he became the first to score a century before lunch on any day of a Test match in Australia.”

“Warner has made the life of his dozen opening partners much easier with his belligerent style. With a strike rate (runs per 100 balls) of 70, Davey took the opposition on. By doing that, he allowed his partners to go about their business sedately, without having to worry about the scoreboard. Doing the heavy lifting came naturally to him.”

“David has always been prepared to play a lot of shots, but he was not reckless. Most of his boundaries have come from classic strokes, though he has the ability to play the unconventional one when needed.”

“Very few can switch-hit with the aplomb of Warner. If needed, he could bat right-handed and make a pretty good fist of it. Pound for pound, no one hits the ball harder than David, but he has soft hands when required.”

The only blemish of Warner’s Test career will be the 2018 Sandpaper scandal in Cape Town, which led to him being banned by Cricket Australia from international and Australian domestic cricket for 12 months. Moreover, he was removed as the vice-captaincy, and banned from taking leadership roles.

“David will never live down the “Sandpaper Gate” incident. That scar on Australian cricket needs to be owned by a lot more people than Warner and Bancroft. Warner’s role in the success of Australian cricket during his time cannot be underestimated.”

“In the modern era, only Virender Sehwag has been more damaging than Warner as an opener. It is rare to have someone at the top of the order who intimidates even the fastest opposition bowlers,” concluded Chappell.

Whatever one thinks of him, David Warner has been fantastic for Australian cricket, says Greg Chappell

Found this article helpful? Spread the word and support us!
summary: Former cricketer Greg Chappell has praised David Warner for his long and successful career in Australian cricket. Warner, set to play his final Test match against Pakistan on January 3, has scored 8695 runs in 111 Tests since his debut in 2011, including 26 fifties and 36 half-centuries. Despite criticism of Warner's portrayal in the public eye, Chapell believes that he has been a fantastic player for Australian cricket and has been praised for his passion, energy, professionalism, and competitiveness. He also highlighted his ability to take the game away from the opposition in quick time. The only blemish of Warner’s Test career will be the 2018 Sandpaper scandal in Cape Town, which led to him being banned from international and Australian domestic cricket for a year and removed from leadership roles.

title: How to watch Washington Wizards vs. Atlanta Hawks: TV channel, NBA live stream info, start time
description: 3rd Quarter Report Fortunes may be turning around for the Hawks after losing four in a row. They have a bit of a cushion as they currently lead the...
content:
Fortunes may be turning around for the Hawks after losing four in a row. They have a bit of a cushion as they currently lead the Wizards 100-87.

If the Hawks keep playing like this, they’ll bump their record up to 13-19 in no time. On the other hand, the Wizards will have to make due with a 6-26 record unless they turn things around (and fast).
• When: Sunday, December 31, 2023 at 3 p.m. ET
• Where: Capital One Arena — Washington, District of Columbia
• Online streaming: fuboTV (Try for free. Regional restrictions may apply.)

What to Know

The Hawks are 8-2 against the Wizards since October of 2021, and they’ll have a chance to extend that success on Sunday. The Atlanta Hawks will head out on the road to face off against the Washington Wizards at 3:00 p.m. ET at Capital One Arena. The Wizards do have the home-court advantage, but the Hawks are expected to win by 6.5 points.

The Hawks’ recent rough patch got a bit rougher on Friday after their fourth straight loss. They fell 117-110 to Sacramento. The Hawks were up 23 in the first but still couldn’t manage to seal the deal.

The match pitted two of the league’s most dominant guards against one another in Trae Young and De’Aaron Fox. Fox had a solid game and scored 31 points along with eight assists and six rebounds. Meanwhile, Young did his best for the losing side, scoring 24 points along with nine assists and four steals.

Even though they lost, the Hawks were smashing the offensive glass and finished the game with 18 offensive rebounds (they’re ranked second in offensive rebounds per game overall). They easily outclassed their opponents in that department as the Kings only pulled down five offensive rebounds.

Even though the Wizards have not done well against the Nets recently (they were 2-8 in their previous ten matchups), they didn’t let the past get in their way on Friday. Washington managed a 110-104 win over Brooklyn. The victory was just what the Wizards needed coming off of a 132-102 defeat in their prior game.

Atlanta has traveled a rocky road recently, as they’ve lost ten of their last 13 matches, which put a noticeable dent in their 12-19 record this season. As for Washington, their win bumped their record up to 6-25.

Some high-performance offense is likely on the agenda as the pair are some of the highest scoring teams in the league. The Hawks haven’t had any problem running up the score this season, having averaged 121.9 points per game (they’re ranked third in scoring overall). However, it’s not like the Wizards struggle in that department as they’ve been averaging 116.4 points per game. With both teams so easily able to put up points, the only question left is who can run the score up higher.

The Hawks took their victory against the Wizards when the teams last played back in November by a conclusive 136-108. Do the Hawks have another victory up their sleeve, or will the Wizards turn the tables on them? We’ll have the answer soon enough.

Atlanta is a solid 6.5-point favorite against Washington, according to the latest NBA odds.

The oddsmakers were right in line with the betting community on this one, as the game opened as a 6.5-point spread, and stayed right there.

The oddsmakers are expecting fireworks from the offense and set the over/under at a high 252.5 points.

See NBA picks for every single game, including this one, from SportsLine’s advanced computer model. Get picks now.

Atlanta has won 8 out of their last 10 games against Washington.
summary: The Atlanta Hawks are set to face the Washington Wizards at 3:00 p.m. ET on December 31, 2023 at Capital One Arena in Washington, DC. The Hawks, who have lost four consecutive games, currently lead the Wizards 100-87. If they continue their winning streak, they could increase their record to 13-19. However, the Wizards, who currently sit at 6-26, will have to contend with a 6-22 record unless they change their fortunes. The game will be televised on fuboTV. The teams last played in November, with Atlanta winning 136-108. The latest NBA odds suggest that high-performance offense is likely on the agenda due to the high scoring teams in the league.

title: Chief Justice John Roberts casts wary eye on the uses of AI in federal courts
description: Chief Justice John Roberts on Sunday turned his focus to the promise, and shortcomings, of artificial intelligence in the federal courts, in an annual report...
content:
WASHINGTON — Chief Justice John Roberts on Sunday turned his focus to the promise, and shortcomings, of artificial intelligence in the federal courts, in an annual report that made no mention of Supreme Court ethics or legal controversies involving Donald Trump.

Describing artificial intelligence as the “latest technological frontier,” Roberts discussed the pros and cons of computer-generated content in the legal profession. His remarks come just a few days after the latest instance of AI-generated fake legal citations making their way into official court records, in a case involving ex-Trump lawyer Michael Cohen.

“Always a bad idea,” Roberts wrote in his year-end report, noting that “any use of AI requires caution and humility.”

At the same time, though, the chief justice acknowledged that AI can make it much easier for people without much money to access the courts. “These tools have the welcome potential to smooth out any mismatch between available resources and urgent needs in our court system,” Roberts wrote.

The report came at the end of a year in which a series of stories questioned the ethical practices of the justices and the court responded to critics by adopting its first code of conduct. Many of those stories focused on Justice Clarence Thomas and his failure to disclose travel, other hospitality and additional financial ties with wealthy conservative donors including Harlan Crow and the Koch brothers. But Justices Samuel Alito and Sonia Sotomayor also have been under scrutiny.

The country also is entering an the beginning of an election year that seems likely to enmesh the court in some way in the ongoing criminal cases against Trump and efforts to keep the Republican former president off the 2024 ballot.

Along with his eight colleagues, Roberts almost never discusses cases that are before the Supreme Court or seem likely to get there. In past reports, he has advocated for enhanced security and salary increases for federal judges, praised judges and their aides for dealing with the coronavirus pandemic and highlighted other aspects of technological changes in the courts.

Roberts once famously compared judges to umpires who call balls and strikes, but don’t make the rules. In his latest report, he turned to a different sport, tennis, to make the point that technology won’t soon replace judges.

At many tennis tournaments, optical technology, rather than human line judges, now determines “whether 130 mile per hour serves are in or out. These decisions involve precision to the millimeter. And there is no discretion; the ball either did or did not hit the line. By contrast, legal determinations often involve gray areas that still require application of human judgment,” Roberts wrote.

Looking ahead warily to the growing use of artificial intelligence in the courts, Roberts wrote: “I predict that human judges will be around for a while. But with equal confidence I predict that judicial work — particularly at the trial level — will be significantly affected by AI.”
summary: Chief Justice John Roberts has expressed caution over the use of artificial intelligence in federal courts, stating that it is always a bad idea and requires caution and humility. However, he acknowledged that AI could make it easier for people without much money to access the courts. This comes after a recent instance of AI-generated fake legal citations being included in court records involving ex-Trump lawyer Michael Cohen. The comments were made in Roberts' annual report, which made no mention of Supreme Court ethics or legal controversies involving Donald Trump. The report also highlighted the potential for enhanced security and salary increases for federal judges, and highlighted other technological changes in the courts' roles.

title: Jon Cryer gets honest about key to good marriage
description: Actor Jon Cryer opens up about what's keeping his marraige to Lisa Joyner thriving -- and comedy has a lot to do with it.
content:
He married Lisa Joyner in 2007 and stated it was the “luckiest day of his life” in a PEOPLE interview. The couple is doing remarkably well, and Jon dishes out some helpful advice on what's made it work.

“The key to a good marriage is 100 percent a sense of humor because whenever there are hard things in a marriage — and there are — laughing about it makes the most wonderful difference,” the actor said. “It's about having somebody in your corner no matter what, and I feel so lucky to be that guy for my wife. She has been there for me every time that has been tough for me.”

This is the Two and a Half Men actor's second marriage. He has a son, Charlie, from his first marriage with ex-wife Sarah Trigger. This marriage ended in 2004, and he has some opinions on what makes this second marriage thrive.

“The great thing about second marriages is you know what your flaws are,” he said. “They have been brought to relief, and so you hopefully have gotten some comfort with them. When you're much more comfortable with yourself, you can actually love somebody a lot better, and I think my earlier relationships were always just trying to be somebody who I thought I had to be instead of just being who I am.”

Catch Jon Cryer in Extended Family on NBC and streaming on Peacock.
summary: Actor Jon Cryer has revealed that the key to a successful marriage is a sense of humor. He married Lisa Joyner in 2007, and the couple is reportedly doing well. This is Cryer's second marriage; he also has a son from his first marriage with ex-wife Sarah Trigger. Cryer attributes his success to his sense of self-relief and comfort in his relationship with his wife. He also mentioned that second marriages bring comfort to their partners, allowing them to become more comfortable with themselves.

title: YEAR IN REVIEW: A look back at July, August and September in Castlegar
description: A reminder of what happened during the third quarter of 2023
content:
July 1: Charges laid in fatal 2022 Purolator/transit bus crash. Almost exactly one year from the day a 19-year-old Quebec student was killed in a collision between a Purolator van and a BC Transit Bus on Highway 3A near Tarrys, charges of driving without due care and attention were laid against the driver of the Purolator van. A few weeks later the mother of the student came forward, releasing details about Jasmine Beausoleil are the organs that were donated upon her death, in hopes of finding their recipients.

July 9: The West Kootenay U13 Wolfpack won their provincial championship. The team played with heart and determination from the first practice of the season and was lead by the players, with lots of guidance from coaches Peter Youngblut, Tom Carew, Jim Marno and Trevor Thirsk.

July 13: Residents at Rota Villa benefited from a huge grant. The Castlegar Villa Society received a $650,000 energy retrofit grant from Clean BC and the Columbia Basin Trust to upgrade the heating and cooling system at the 40-unit non-profit seniors complex.

July 29: Mercer Celgar curtailed operations at its Castlegar mill. The curtailment lasted about three weeks and was due to a significant loss of rail transport capacity resulting from the Vancouver port job action.

July 29 - Aug. 5: The Castlegar Fire Department battled eight suspicious fires in eight days. The fires were started in various locations around the area including Blueberry, Fairview, Zuckerburg Island, Genelle, Woodland Park and north Castlegar.

Aug 2: Two unrelated fires in the Tarrys area had tragic consequences. A house fire on McHardy Road in Shoreacres took the life of one man. Another fire destroyed a parked vehicle and travel trailer off of Highway 3A just north of the Tarrys Fire Hall. A man who was living in the trailer was inside when the fire started. A friend was able to get the man out of the trailer, but not before he sustained burns.

Aug. 4: An arson fire severely damaged a Canadian Pacific Rail bridge in Genelle. The fire caused about $1 million in damages to the CP trestle bridge north of Lower China Creek Road.

Aug 5: The Davidson Brook wildfire begins. The human-caused fire burned for about two weeks within City of Castelgar Boundaries. It spread to about 2.1 hectares in a forested area above the Oglow subdivision.

Aug 7: Many of Castlegar’s floral displays died due to a watering error. Floral displays were watered by a city truck that had been using calcium chloride for dust control. The tank had not been properly flushed before watering the flowers.

Aug. 10: Federal electoral riding changes kept the Castlegar area intact. The new Similkameen-South Okanagan-West Kootenay riding will include Castlegar and its surrounding communities, Rossland, Warfield, Genelle, Grand Forks, Osoyoos, Penticton and Princeton as well as the smaller communities in between. The new Columbia-Kootenay-Southern Rockies riding will include Trail, Montrose, Fruitvale, Salmo, Nelson, Creston, Cranbrook and the rest of the East Kootenay region.

Aug. 15: The Goose Creek wildfire started. The wildfire was located about 15 kilometres north of Castlegar near Pass Creek. The lightning-caused fire received a full response from BC Wildfire Service that included helicopters, planes and at times over 30 ground crews working at once. It burned about 10 hectares.

Aug. 21: Castlegar launched a new curbside organics collection. The addition resulted in a major change to the city’s waste collection program with a reduction in cart size for garbage, still collected every other week, and the addition of a large cart for organics that is collected every week. Curbside collection of yard waste was added to the program as part of the organic stream. Recycling continues to be collected every other week. By October, Castlegar garbage volume was cut in half.

Aug. 30: Castlegar Hospice Society said goodbye to its long-time director. One of Castlegar’s most compassionate and well-known community members said farewell to the city and her role as the agency’s executive director. Suzanne Lehbauer had been steering the ship at Castlegar Hospice for seventeen years, but she has now set her sails on a new course that leads her closer to family.

Aug. 30: A $2 million lottery ticket was sold in Castlegar. Sharon McFadden purchased the ticket at Castlegar Pharmasave on her way home from getting a haircut. The McFaddens plan to spend most of the money helping out their family and will use the rest for some home renovations for themselves.

Sept. 7: Coroner’s inquest into Castlegar police shooting death released its recommendations. Waylon Edey was 39 years old when he was shot and killed by police on the Kinnaird Bridge in Castlegar. On Jan. 29, 2015, Const. Jason Tait attempted to pull over a drunk driver. When Edey did not stop, a series of events occurred that led to Tait fatally shooting Edey. The jury’s recommendations included police body cameras for police officers, dash cams on police vehicles, more training for officers in de-escalating high-stress situations, and new provincial and federal laws to prevent prohibited drivers from getting behind the wheel. The jury also recommended that the City of Castlegar should review staffing levels “to ensure the community is adequately policed.” The recommendation to the city was somewhat frustrating as the city already reviews staffing levels with local RCMP at least once a month and the city has no control over how many police officers are assigned to the area, or how many hours they work. Those decisions are made by the province and the RCMP.

Sept 12: A Molotov cocktail was used to start a fire at a Castlegar home. A man and his 10-year-old son escaped an arson fire at their home in the 2900 block of 5th Avenue thanks to some alert neighbours. Around 1 a.m., a teen saw fire coming from his neighbour’s property and quickly called emergency services and rushed to the home with a fire extinguisher. Liam Harder was later honoured for his role in keeping the fire from spreading.
summary: The year ended with charges laid in the death of a 19-year-old Quebec student, Jasmine Beausoleil, who was killed in a collision between a Purolator van and a BC Transit Bus on Highway 3A near Tarrys. The West Kootenay U13 Wolfpack won their provincial championship. Residents at Rota Villa received a $650,000 energy retrofit grant from Clean BC and the Columbia Basin Trust to upgrade the heating and cooling system at the 40-unit non-profit seniors complex. Mercer Celgar curtailed operations at its Castlegar mill for three weeks due to a significant loss of rail transport capacity due to the Vancouver port job action. An arson fire severely damaged a Canadian Pacific Rail bridge in Genelle, causing about $1 million in damages. The Davidson Brook wildfire burned for about two weeks within City of Castelgar Boundaries and spread to about 2.1 hectares above the Oglow subdivision. The city of CastLegar launched a new curbside organics collection and a reduction in garbage volume was cut by October. Suzanne Lehbauer, the executive director of Castlega, was sold on a $2 million lottery ticket.

title: SilverStar getting lit for New Year’s Eve with torch parade, fireworks
description: A beer garden and live music will also help ring in the new year on the mountain
content:
It’s the final day of 2023, and SilverStar Mountain Resort has a night of warm beverages, dazzling lights and colourful pyrotechnics in store for folks looking to ring in the new year.

SilverStar’s New Year’s Eve celebration takes place tonight, and the village is already bustling with activity.

“Enjoy a magical evening in your very own snow globe this New Years at Silver Star!” the resort said. “Join us for a sparkling NYE, with lots of glimmering lights, hot chocolate, s’mores around the fire, and of course, a magnificent fireworks display.”

New this year is New Year’s Après, with a local DJ and a beer garden from 2 p.m. to 5 p.m. at the end of the village.

A village market is also taking place from 2 p.m. to 5 p.m. Then at 5 p.m. there will be a torchlight parade down the mountain, with fireworks to follow immediately after.

At 9 p.m., The Liz Blair Project will fill the evening with live music at The Red Antler.

READ MORE: A look at the top stories that resonated in B.C. in 2023
summary: SilverStar Mountain Resort is set to celebrate New Year's Eve with a New Year’s Eve celebration, including a torch parade, fireworks, and a beer garden. The resort will also feature a local DJ, a village market, and live music at The Red Antler. At 5 p.m., there will be a fireworks display and a torchlight parade down the mountain. The event will also include a live music performance by The Liz Blair Project.

title: «Μας χτυπούσε συνέχεια» - Συγκλονίζει η μητέρα του 35χρονου που σκότωσε τον πατέρα του
description: Το μεσημέρι ο δράστης οδηγήθηκε στον Εισαγγελέα. Εκεί ήταν και η μητέρα του για να του συμπαρασταθεί πέφτοντας στην αγκαλιά του γιου της όταν τον είδε με τις χειροπέδες.
content:
Στο πλάι του 35χρονου πατροκτόνου στέκεται η τραγική μητέρα του που για χρόνια βίωνε την κακοποιητική συμπεριφορά του 62χρονου συζύγου της οποίος έπεσε νεκρός από το μαχαίρι του ίδιου του παιδιού στο Περιστέρι.

Το έγκλημα έφερε στην επιφάνεια τα χρόνια προβλήματα ενδοοικογενειακής βίας που βίωναν η μητέρα με τα παιδιά της και δράστη τον 62χρονο.

Ο 35χρονος όπως είπε στους αστυνομικούς δεν άντεξε για άλλη μια φορά να βλέπει τον πατέρα του να χτυπά τη μητέρα και πάνω στον καβγά που είχαν τον χτύπησε με ένα μαχαίρι.

«Προσπάθησε να επιτεθεί στη μητέρα μου, θόλωσα και τον σκότωσα» φέρεται να είπε στους αστυνομικούς

Ένα από τα τραύματα που του προκάλεσε, αυτό στο πόδι, ήταν θανατηφόρο με τον 62χρονο να χάνει τη ζωή του από αιμορραγία.

Το μεσημέρι ο δράστης οδηγήθηκε στον Εισαγγελέα. Εκεί ήταν και η μητέρα του για να του συμπαρασταθεί πέφτοντας στην αγκαλιά του γιου της όταν τον είδε με τις χειροπέδες.

Η γυναίκα, σύζυγος του θύματος και μητέρα του δράστη ήταν μέσα στο σπίτι την ώρα του φονικού.

Στην κατάθεση της στους αστυνομικούς της Ασφάλειας Δυτικής Αττικής περιέγραψε όσα βίωνε τόσο η ίδια όσο και τα παιδιά τους στα χέρια του άνδρα της όλα αυτά τα χρόνια.

«Ο σύζυγος μου ήταν επιθετικός. Με χτυπούσε πολλές φορές. Τα παιδιά έβλεπαν όσα βίωνα ενώ βιαιοπραγούσε και σε βάρος τους. Την ώρα του τσακωμού εγώ ήμουν στο δωμάτιο. Άκουσα τις φωνές και όταν βγήκα τον είδα πεσμένο στο πάτωμα ματωμένο.

Λίγο μετά τα μεσάνυχτα ο 62χρονος που επί χρόνια, σύμφωνα με αστυνομικές πηγές, κακοποιούσε την σύζυγο του και μητέρα του 35χρονου διαπληκτίστηκε έντονα μια ακόμη φορά με τον γιο του.

Ο οξύθυμος χαρακτήρας του γινόταν ακόμη πιο επικίνδυνος λόγω του αλκοόλ που κατανάλωνε.

Ο 35χρονος με ένα μαχαίρι μόλις 6 εκατοστών επιτέθηκε στον πατέρα του και τον τραυμάτισε σε διάφορα σημεία του σώματος του.

Η μοιραία μαχαιριά όμως ήταν στο πόδι του 62χρονου που ξεψύχησε χάνοντας μεγάλη ποσότητά αίματος. Ο ίδιος ο δράστης ήταν αυτός που επικοινώνησε με τις αρχές.

«Σας τηλεφωνώ από το Περιστέρι. Ελάτε στην οδό … Σκότωσα τον πατέρα μου».

Στο σπίτι της οικογένειας έφτασαν άνδρες της Άμεσης Δράσης και ασθενοφόρο του ΕΚΑΒ όμως ο 62χρονος είχε ήδη χάσει την ζωή του.
translation:
By the side of the 35-year-old parricide stands his tragic mother who for years experienced the abusive behavior of her 62-year-old husband who was killed by the knife of his own child in Peristeri.

The crime brought to the surface the chronic problems of domestic violence experienced by the mother and her children and the 62-year-old perpetrator.

The 35-year-old, as he told the police, couldn't bear to see his father beating his mother once again, and during the fight they had, he hit him with a knife.

"He tried to attack my mother, I blurred and killed him" he allegedly told the officers

One of the wounds he inflicted on him, the one on the leg, was fatal with the 62-year-old losing his life from bleeding.

At noon the perpetrator was taken to the Prosecutor. His mother was also there to support him, falling into her son's arms when she saw him in handcuffs.

The woman, wife of the victim and mother of the perpetrator, was in the house at the time of the murder.

In her statement to the Western Attica Security Police, she described what she and their children experienced at the hands of her husband all these years.

“My husband was aggressive. He hit me many times. The children saw what I was going through while he was abusing them. I was in the room at the time of the fight. I heard the voices and when I came out I saw him lying on the floor covered in blood.

Shortly after midnight, the 62-year-old who, according to police sources, had been abusing his wife and mother of the 35-year-old for years had a heated argument with his son once again.

His short temper was made even more dangerous by the alcohol he consumed.

The 35-year-old with a knife of only 6 cm attacked his father and wounded him in various parts of his body.

But the fatal stab was in the leg of the 62-year-old who cooled down losing a large amount of blood. The perpetrator himself was the one who contacted the authorities.

"I am calling you from Peristeri. Come to the street ... I killed my father."

Men of the Immediate Action and an ambulance of the EKAV arrived at the family's house, but the 62-year-old had already lost his life.
translated_title: "He kept hitting us" - The mother of the 35-year-old who killed his father is shocked
translated_description: At noon the perpetrator was taken to the Prosecutor. His mother was also there to support him, falling into her son's arms when she saw him in handcuffs.
translated_summary: The 35-year-old son of the perpetrator, who killed his own father in Peristeri, Greece, has been accused of murdering him with a knife. The incident highlighted the chronic problems of domestic violence experienced by the mother and her children, who for years experienced the abusive behavior of her 62-year old husband. The 35-born perpetrator allegedly used a knife to kill his father, who was fatally wounded by the wound on the leg. His mother was present at the time of the murder. The perpetrator himself contacted the authorities, but had already lost his life. The woman's statement to the Western Attica Security Police described her husband's aggressive behavior towards her and their children.

title: Μαρούσι -Παναθηναϊκος 79-92: Έκλεισαν αήττητοι τον πρώτο γύρο οι «πράσινοι»
description: Ο Παναθηναϊκός αποχαιρέτησε με εκτός έδρας νίκη, 92-79, επί του αδύναμου Αμαρουσίου το 2023 και θα κάνει Πρωτοχρονιά αήττητος σε 12 αγωνιστικές στην Basket...
content:
Ο Παναθηναϊκός αποχαιρέτησε με εκτός έδρας νίκη, 92-79, επί του αδύναμου Αμαρουσίου το 2023 και θα κάνει Πρωτοχρονιά αήττητος σε 12 αγωνιστικές στην Basket League .

Η ανωτερότητα των «πρασίνων» έναντι της ομάδας του Γιώργου Λιμνιάτη φάνηκε από τα πρώτα λεπτά, με τον Λούκα Βιλντόσα ν' αναδεικνύεται πρώτος σκόρερ, με 19 πόντους (5/8 τρίποντα). Εξαιρετικός ήταν για μία ακόμη φορά ο Μάριους Γκριγκόνις με 16 πόντους (3/5 τρίποντα). Διψήφιοι ήταν και οι Ναν (12π., 5ασ.) και Ερνανγκόμεθ (11π., 8ρ.).

Ο Κώστας Σλούκας δεν μετέβη στο ΟΑΚΑ, καθώς ταλαιπωρείται από ένα κρυολόγημα. Εκτός δωδεκάδας άφησε ο Αταμάν τον Ματίας Λεσόρ για να ξεκουραστεί, ενώ ο Κάιλ Γκάι ήταν μεν εκεί (εκτός δωδεκάδας) αλλά έτοιμος να φτιάξει βαλίτσες καθώς θα μείνει ελεύθερος από τους «πράσινους». Ο Ιωάννης Παπαπέτρου παρακολούθησε από τον πάγκο το ματς, μετρώντας αντίστροφα για την επιστροφή του στην αγωνιστική δράση με το νέο έτος.

Πλέον, οι «πράσινοι» επικεντρώνονται στα δύο εκτός έδρας ματς αυτής της «διαβολοβδομάδας» στη Euroleague στην Ισπανία, με Μπασκόνια (3/1, 21:30) και με Βαλένθια στις 5 Ιανουαρίου (21:30).

Από το Μαρούσι που υποχώρησε στο 4-8, ξεχώρισαν οι Χάρης Γιαννόπουλος (17π. με 4/7 τρίποντα), Ρόμπερτ Γούνταρντ (14π., 5ρ.) και Νάικι Σιμπάντε (13π.). Το Μαρούσι ισοβαθμεί με Κολοσσό και Λαύριο, με 16 βαθμούς, ενώ Καρδίτσα και Απόλλων Πατρών ισοβαθμούν στην τελευταία θέση με 14 βαθμούς.
translation:
Panathinaikos said goodbye to 2023 with an away victory, 92-79, over weak Amarousios and will enter the New Year undefeated in 12 games in the Basket League.

The superiority of the "greens" over Giorgos Limniatis' team was evident from the first minutes, with Lukas Vildosa emerging as the top scorer, with 19 points (5/8 three-pointers). Marius Grigonis was excellent once again with 16 points (3/5 three-pointers). Nan (12p., 5as.) and Hernangomet (11p., 8r.) were also in double figures.

Kostas Slukas did not go to OAKA, as he is suffering from a cold. Out of the dozen, Ataman left Matias Lessor to rest, while Kyle Guy was there (out of the dozen) but ready to pack his bags as he will be free from the "greens". Ioannis Papapetrou watched the match from the bench, counting down to his return to action in the new year.

Now, the "greens" focus on the two away matches of this "devil's week" in the Euroleague in Spain, with Basconia (3/1, 21:30) and with Valencia on January 5 (21:30).

From Maroussi, which dropped to 4-8, Haris Yiannopoulos (17 points with 4/7 three-pointers), Robert Woodard (14 points, 5 points) and Nike Sibande (13 points) stood out. Maroussi is tied with Kolossos and Lavrio, with 16 points, while Karditsa and Apollon Patrons are tied for last place with 14 points.

title: Carolina Panthers owner David Tepper appears to throw drink at Jacksonville Jaguars fans
description: Carolina Panthers owner David Tepper appeared to throw his drink at Jaguars fans on Sunday at EverBank Stadium in Jacksonville.
content:
Carolina Panthers owner David Tepper appeared to throw a drink toward Jacksonville Jaguars fans in the stands at EverBank Stadium in Jacksonville on Sunday.

The Panthers lost, 26-0, dropping the team to 2-14 in what was the franchise's first shutout loss since 2002. The defeat assured that the Panthers would finish with the worst record of any team in the league this season.

After the game, a video showing Tepper throwing the contents of his cup began circulating on social media.

"We are aware of the video and have no further comment at this time," NFL spokesman Brian McCarthy told USA TODAY Sports in an email.

Tepper fired coach Frank Reich in November, just 10 months after hiring him, following the team's 1-10 start. With the move marking the third time he has dismissed a coach since buying the Panthers in 2018, he pushed back against questions about his patience as an owner.

“I do have patience. My reputation away from this game is one of extreme patience,” Tepper said in a news conference. “There’s no reason why that doesn’t come here, too. Now, that patience comes with good performance and wanting to see progress made in different aspects."

This article originally appeared on USA TODAY: David Tepper appears to throw drink at Jaguars fans as Panthers lose
summary: Carolina Panthers owner David Tepper appeared to throw a drink at Jacksonville Jaguars fans during a game against the Panthers, which ended in a 26-0 loss, marking the franchise's first shutout loss since 2002. The video of Tepper throwing a drink also surfaced on social media. The team's poor performance led to the Panthers' worst record of any team in the league this season. Tepper recently fired coach Frank Reich after only 10 months into his tenure, marking his third dismissal since buying the Panthers in 2018.

title: 10 Cities Where Homebuyers Have More Options
description: 10 Cities Where Homebuyers Have More Options - Off Plan Property Exchange
content:
If you were on the fence about entering the housing market in 2023, you likely encountered a challenging environment with high mortgage rates and limited inventory. However, the outlook for 2024 appears more promising, with mortgage rates dropping below 7% in mid-December and an increase in homes hitting the market in certain locations. It seems that the long-awaited dream of buying a home might become a reality in some areas.

While the overall housing market in 2024 is projected to remain challenging, Realtor.com predicts that sales will be on par with 2023, with over 4 million units sold. Existing homeowners will continue to face difficult decisions when it comes to moving, with job changes and other life events prompting necessary relocations.

As always, the key factor in the real estate market is location. To identify cities with an increase in homes for sale, Realtor.com conducted a study focusing on new listings in the South and Midwest. By comparing new listings in October and September, as well as analyzing the changes in new listings over the past three months, Realtor.com identified 10 diverse communities where homebuyers have a better chance of finding a wider selection of homes on the market.

Here are 10 cities highlighted by the study:

1. Greensboro, North Carolina

 – Median home list price in October: $320,950

 – New listings in October: 782

 – Percentage change in new listings from September to October: -0.3%

2. Chattanooga, Tennessee

 – Median home list price in October: $418,700

 – New listings in October: 786

 – Percentage change in new listings from September to October: 6.2%

3. Shreveport, Louisiana

 – Median home list price in October: $246,500

 – New listings in October: 422

 – Percentage change in new listings from September to October: 6.6%

4. Charleston, South Carolina

 – Median home list price in October: $538,248

 – New listings in October: 1,312

 – Percentage change in new listings from September to October: 7.2%

5. Richmond, Virginia

 – Median home list price in October: $435,000

 – New listings in October: 1,506

 – Percentage change in new listings from September to October: 7.3%

6. Killeen, Texas

 – Median home list price in October: $315,750

 – New listings in October: 644

 – Percentage change in new listings from September to October: 8.1%

7. Youngstown, Ohio

 – Median home list price in October: $168,675

 – New listings in October: 580

 – Percentage change in new listings from September to October: 9.0%

8. Port St. Lucie, Florida

 – Median home list price in October: $472,658

 – New listings in October: 1,136

 – Percentage change in new listings from September to October: 10.9%

9. Flint, Michigan

 – Median home list price in October: $192,000

 – New listings in October: 544

 – Percentage change in new listings from September to October: 13.3%

10. Peoria, Illinois

 – Median home list price in October: $164,800

 – New listings in October: 460

 – Percentage change in new listings from September to October: 13.9%

If you’re in the market for a new home, these cities offer a higher inventory of homes to choose from. It’s important to consider your specific needs and preferences when making a decision, but these communities provide a great starting point in your search for the perfect home.

1. Will mortgage rates continue to drop in 2024?

 While mortgage rates have recently fallen below 7%, it’s difficult to predict their future trajectory. Various factors, such as economic conditions and government policies, can influence mortgage rates.

2. How can I determine the best location to buy a home?

 Consider factors like job opportunities, cost of living, and quality of life when deciding on the best location to buy a home. It’s also helpful to research local real estate market trends and consult with a real estate agent.

3. Are these cities the only ones with an increase in home listings?

 The study conducted by Realtor.com focused on the 150 largest metropolitan areas and identified these 10 cities as examples with an increase in home listings. There may be other cities with similar trends.

4. Should I wait to buy a home if the market is challenging?

 Deciding when to buy a home depends on your personal circumstances and financial situation. While a challenging market can make it harder to find and purchase a home, it’s essential to consider factors like interest rates and housing prices to make an informed decision.

5. Should I seek assistance from a real estate agent?

 Working with a real estate agent can be beneficial when navigating the homebuying process. They can provide valuable insights, help you find suitable properties, and negotiate on your behalf.
summary: Realtor.com has identified 10 cities where homebuyers have a better chance of finding a wider selection of homes on the market. The study was conducted to identify these cities based on new listings in the South and Midwest. While the overall housing market in 2024 is expected to remain challenging, Realtor.'com predicts sales will be on par with 2023 with over 4 million units sold. Existing homeowners will continue to face difficult decisions about moving due to job changes and other life events. Factors such as job opportunities, cost of living, and real estate market trends can also influence mortgage rates.

title: Climate Change In Mallorca
description: 2024 begins with an eye on the effects of climate change, which is more common in the Balearic Islands. Mallorca's aquifers and reservoirs are at 40% and 30%
content:
2024 begins with an eye on the effects of climate change, which is more common in the Balearic Islands. Mallorca’s aquifers and reservoirs are at 40% and 30% of their capacity respectively and desalination plants continue to operate in the middle of winter with the aim of conserving water as much as possible. natural water resources than the arrival of the high tourist season. The change in Mallorca’s water management model is marked by the attack of global warming, which reduces pluviometry and at the same time increases the frequency of Heavy rain. The general direction of Water Resources of Government, with John Calafat of controls, will convene city councils and supply companies this January to, in the most consensual way possible, draw up a common course to follow.

Construction of new plants desalination plantsTHE leak reduction of supply networks and the possibility of establishing for the first time a combined rate of water consumption for each Island some of the questions will be put on the table. “Abaqua is selling desalinated water below its true price and the situation is unsustainable,” Calafat said. Drinking water supply and wastewater treatment are two basic issues for an island that continues to grow in population every year as more and more tourists visit it.

“It is true that there are planning instruments such as the Hydrological Plan and the Drought Plan, but the truth is that we are concerned about lack of water and wetland conservation. “We need to set off all the alarms because this is an issue linked to the climate crisis and climate emergency,” he said. Margalida Ramisspokesperson for GOB SEARCHED.

Be warned that the new Housing law decree of the Government “has a direct impact on municipal planning, but it also has an impact on public services and facilities. If the residential spaces increase, the population, water consumption and the flow that reaches the treatment plants will also increase,” he added.

“It is necessary to adapt to climate change scenarios and the GOB will be there to request that the construction concessions that threaten our beaches be removed. We have been pushing for some time to remove those beach bars that are still operating there are concessions that expired in 2018, but some of them continue with extensions. In addition, there are still beach bars operating with expired concessions, this is the case of Bungallow and we know with more. We need to remove the frontline infrastructure and reconsider environments with walks in the first line of mar,” said the GOB spokesperson.

the Ministry of Environment announces that in 2024 it will commit to policies for the conservation of natural spaces, promoting public-private shared management, something that worries the GOB. «The population should enjoy all that natural Protected Areas y natural parks what is in the Balearic Islands. The activity of these spaces must be adapted to today’s world and new formulas must be found,” said the Department of Medi Environment directed by Jto Simonet.

Among the challenges of the Government for 2024 is the review of Natural Resources Management Plans in the Balearic Islands. Nine of the four current management plans are before 2023 and in the 13 most protected areas of the Island, the Governing Plan for the Use of Cabrera National Park is being implemented. Four more are awaiting review and eight have no immediate plans to use.

At the end of a year with record number of population and overcrowding of tourists Having instruments that regulate the permitted use of natural spaces in the Balearic Islands is more necessary than ever. Medi Ambient Guaranteed including the private sector to manage public forests. “The profit of companies in the forest sector must be emphasized and the use of biomass is promoted,” said Medi Ambient sources.

On the other hand, the GOB is particularly concerned “that some lobbies are doing business in natural spaces, such as hunters». “We have to listen and pay for this weight,” he added.

In matters of energy, the GOB will especially monitor the building photovoltaic parks on rustic land in Mallorca and warns that he will be careful once and for all Council of Mallorca approve a zoning which prevents rural land from becoming photovoltaic industrial estates. It works in collaboration with other conservation entities within the framework of the ‘Renewable yes, but así no’ platform.

The GOB predicted that crowded with touristscruise ships and beach saturation will continue to be protagonists in 2024. “We will emphasize the need for a change in the model to an ecosocial transition,” said Margalida Ramis.

Marilles It is one of the entities of the Island that works the most to improve the quality of sea water. Raquel Vaquer Sunyer He is the coordinator of the Balearic Report on water quality. “The big challenges for the year 2024 are to achieve a sustainable fishing and end illegal fishing (professional and recreational), expanding the number of marine protected areasimprove the protection of habitat and species and water quality. “We see a gradual deterioration in water quality which is supported by the bioindicators analyzed by Water resources which allows us to make a relatively strong diagnosis,” warned Raquel Vaquer.

Marilles will work to stop the degradation and try to improve the water quality from there. “One must improve the sewage system with large losses that cause untreated water to enter coastal areas. We know that the water that comes to the treatment plants has a lot of salt and that shows that the sea water comes in,” said the expert. That’s why he considers it important to “improve the pollution of the first beach.”

This is a concern shared by the director general of Water Resources, John Calafat. “We need to separate the storm water from the waste, which is not separated in most of our towns and cities,” he said. From his point of view “we need an infrastructure plan with a global vision, we have major purification projects that have been stopped because we have to cross a farm.”

The construction of new storm tanks (such as Palm) relieves treatment plants during periods of heavy rain and avoids unwanted discharges. Marilles also asked the administration to take the necessary measures to prevent the continued existence of coastal houses not connected to sewage, one of the pending subjects. It cannot be ignored that the origin of polluted sea water discharges often occurs in the ocean. «The majority of ports and yacht clubs do not have good dirty water service and many ships fell into the sea“This is something that needs to be regulated, monitored and punished,” explained Raquel Vaquer.

Indeed we know that Balearics It is the autonomous community with the largest number of boat registrations. Water quality is deteriorating, largely due to human tourism and nautical pressure and the lack of regulation of marine space. the rays and sharks They are the groups with the most dangerous species, because their life cycle is very long. They take many years to breed). There is also thought to be a decline in syngnathids such as garfish or seahorses that live in shallow bays.

In expert opinion “There is a lot of pedagogy missing”. Toilet flushes continue to cause pipe breaks on a daily basis. In some sewers in Palma you can read ‘The sea starts here’ but it’s shocking to see what people can flush down the toilet. There have been cases of fasteners causing the destruction of purification networks.

The Marilles Foundation promoted the call Balearic Blue Pact which includes five steps to improve the quality of our oceans: Expansion and development of marine areas, sustainable fishing, water quality, protection of habitats and species and which wants to achieve that 1% of budgets are dedicated to Marine conservation. “The agreement has broad support from society, it was signed by hoteliers and builders and it was also approved by the Parliament, now we need to see that it is fulfilled,” said the expert.

The Ministry of Environment plans to commit to policies for the conservation of natural spaces and promote public-private shared management. The GOB also plans to review the review of Natural Resources Management Plans in the Balearic Islands, with nine of the four current management plans before 2023 and in the 13 most protected areas of the Island, the Governing Plan for the Use of Cabrera National Park is being implemented. The Department of Medi Environment urges adaptation to adapt to climate change scenarios and warns against the construction concessions that threaten our beaches.

title: The Government is committed to strengthening the dialogue with the CGT to avoid a general strike
description: With the date of national strike scheduled for January 24 put by the Central Confederation of Labor…
content:
With the date of national strike scheduled for January 24 put by the Central Confederation of Labor (CGT)different key areas of the government of Javier Miley they appeal to accept the dialogue with union leaders to avoid hardening the streets.

The escalation of conflict increases and although they consider that Milei still has “70 percent support” – although they avoid specifying where the number comes from – they are fearful of the passage of time.

The CGT closes the dialogue with the Government and becomes tougher in the street

From the beginning, as even the representatives of the different unions that make up the Central Confederation of Labor (CGT), the dialogue with the ruling party was cordial and on good terms until the publication of the Decree of Necessity and Urgency (DNU) that directly attacks the established union system.

Milei’s Government is divided between the “conciliators” and the “hardliners”

Government sources explained to the agency Argentine News that the libertarian administration is divided between “the good and conciliatory“, in charge of building political agreements and garnering support, which could include ministers Guillermo Francos (Interior), Sandra Pettovello (Human Capital) and the head of the Chamber of Deputies, Martin Menemand the “bad or harder“, who mark the line of the administration, among which the President and other officials such as Patricia Bullrich (Security).

The Government’s intention via the area headed by the Secretary of Labor, Omar Yasinis to refine the dialogue established today with some isolated referents and even let it be known that the president is willing to receive them with the intention of avoiding the measure of January 24 that began with a mobilization to the Courts.

The first approximation of Armando Cavalierigeneral secretary of the Trade Union, with Pettovello and Yasín, woke up distrust and antipathy between the triumvirs and union leaders already in tension with the Government due to the limit on extraordinary contributions from members and non-members, better known as “solidarity contributions”, and the authorization of private companies to collect contributions from workers, without going through the social work established in the DNU.

Manuel Adorni criticized the CGT strike: “His vision is biased by other interests”

Despite the postponement of the scheduled meeting with CGT leaders due to the publication of the DNU, the president’s collaborators seek to appeal to the moderate wing of the center and do not rule out reviving the call to reduce tension and centralize the alternative dialogues already open, including with the presence of the President.

entities.data: the Decree of Necessity and Urgency

summary: The Central Confederation of Labor (CGT) has planned a national strike on January 24, with key areas of the government of Javier Miley urging them to accept dialogue with union leaders to avoid further conflict. The escalation of conflict began when the Decree of Necessity and Urgency (DNU) was published, which directly attacks the established union system. The CGT closed the dialogue with the Government and became tougher in the street. The Government is committed to strengthening the dialogue to avoid a general strike. Despite postponing a scheduled meeting with CGT leaders due to the DNU's publication, Miley's collaborators have appealed to the moderate wing of the center and do not rule out reviving the call to reduce tension and centralize the alternative dialogues.
