title: APBF for new policies, reforms to promote Ease of Doing Business in 2024
description: ISLAMABAD-The All Pakistan Business Forum (APBF) has stressed the need for new policies and widespread structural reforms in the upcoming year of 2024 to help
content:
ISLAMABAD-The All Pakistan Business Forum (APBF) has stressed the need for new policies and widespread structural reforms in the upcoming year of 2024 to help investors launch their ventures with ease and comfort, as the country has been lagging behind in the ease of doing business index over the years and especially in the concluding year of 2023.

The APBF President Syed Maaz Mahmood, in a new year message released to media on Sunday, observed that a policy should be finalised after incorporating inputs from real stakeholders of the business community, including the APBF, with the sole aim of facilitating foreign and domestic investment by removing the unnecessary bureaucratic and administrative hurdles that slow down the process of starting new business ventures and hinder economic growth.

Quoting the figures, he stated that in the recent Ease of Doing Business Index, Pakistan is considerably behind peer economies, ranking 108 out of 190. In the regulatory area of Starting a Business, Pakistan ranked 72 out of 190 countries. The scope of the new policy intervention in 2024 should be limited to NOCs required by federal regulatory agencies for incorporation and starting operations of a business activity. This policy should cover business registration and authorisation required for business operations. The policy should be applicable on all public sector entities of the federal and provincial governments that regulate businesses.

The World Bank Group’s Doing Business project provides a measure of the “Ease of Doing Business” through a set of objective indicators that focus on the impacts of laws, regulations and their enforcement across 190 economies. The government claimed that it has consistently been making efforts to improve business environment in the country. In previous years, almost 300 reforms have been implemented to improve investment climate in the country, it added. But the growing political uncertainty and institutional imbalances are adversely affecting the country’s perception. The World Bank in a publication has reported the country’s current economic model is not working since it has fallen behind its peers, significant progress in poverty reduction has now started to reverse, and the benefits of growth have accrued to a narrow elite.

Improving the efficiency of power distribution companies to encourage exports through increased private participation, and address the very high costs of electricity generation through increased renewable generation. He underlined that fiscal management must be drastically improved, and debt servicing costs and domestic revenue mobilisation are at unsustainable levels, leaving adequate resources to invest in human development and infrastructure, address economic challenges. Cutting red tape as well as opportunities for costly discretion in the government’s dealing with businesses is paramount. Structural macroeconomic imbalances, particularly on the fiscal side, will remain a prerequisite to ensure a more stable economic environment to attract investors.

The country is at a losing end insofar as poverty alleviation is concerned. Pakistan also has the lowest per capita income in South Asia and highest out-of-school kids in the world. In comparison with the region, Pakistan’s per capita income, as of 2023, is $1,660 as compared to $3,700 of Vietnam, $2,700 of Bangladesh $2,380 of India. In the 80s, Pakistan’s per capita income was far head of these countries’. Furthermore, as of 2023, India’s GDP at $.7 trillion is 11 times higher than Pakistan’s GDP of $341 billion. The APBF leader Maaz Mahmood said the policy should simplify the process of registering a business venture and minimize delays, as one of the significant regulatory barriers to investment and doing business in Pakistan is compliance with no-objection certificates, which are commonly considered regulatory barriers in obtaining regulatory approvals to investments and doing business. Through this policy, the government must plan to replace NOCs requirement for business regulation with a system of compliance verification through an effective mechanism that should operate in federal regulatory agencies adopting this policy and cover related procedures.

He said that the use of NOCs should be replaced progressively at the federal as well as provincial level by a risk-based and inter-agency compliance verification mechanism to facilitate investments and doing business in Pakistan. The low levels of investment can be attributed to a complex, multi-layered, and opaque regulatory regime that involves enforcement by federal, provincial, and municipal government agencies. Regulatory instruments used under this regime consist of various registrations, licenses, permits, and certificates, including NOCs. These regulatory requirements significantly increase the cost of doing business. He argued that the Ease of Doing Business could help promote entrepreneurship, innovation and job creation, besides stimulating economic growth, removing unnecessary delays and procedures.
summary: The All Pakistan Business Forum (APBF) has called for new policies and structural reforms in 2025 to promote the Ease of Doing Business index. The APBF President, Syed Maaz Mahmood, stated that a policy should be finalised after incorporating inputs from stakeholders such as the business community. The policy should aim to facilitate foreign and domestic investment by removing unnecessary bureaucratic and administrative hurdles that slow down the process of starting new business ventures and hinder economic growth. The scope of the policy intervention in 2025 should be limited to NOCs required by federal regulatory agencies for incorporation and starting operations of a business activity. This policy should also cover business registration and authorisation required for business operations. Mahmood also highlighted the need for improved fiscal management and debt servicing costs and domestic revenue mobilisation at unsustainable levels.

title: Villager moved to memory care facility after spending more than six months in jail
description: A 79-year-old Villager who served six months after an ongoing feud with her neighbor won’t be facing criminal charges.
content:
A 79-year-old Villager who served six months after an ongoing feud with her neighbor won’t be facing criminal charges.

Charges have been dropped in the case of 79-year-old Janice Frances McKee of the Village of Hacienda East who had been held in jail for more than six months. She was released from jail on Dec. 20.

After she was released from jail, she was transported an assisted living/memory care facility in The Villages.

McKee’s attorney had indicated his client has been diagnosed with dementia “which is manifested by paranoia, impaired reality testing, memory deficits, and a lack of insight,” according to a document on file in Sumter County Court. In addition, family members stepped in and were granted a guardianship over McKee.

McKee and her husband purchased their home in 2016. He died one year later.

She was arrested June 8 after allegedly trimming her neighbor’s tree in what appears to be a long-running dispute. She had been free on $2,000 bond when she was arrested a second time on June 23 when she drove onto her neighbor’s lawn with her golf cart and proceeded to hit her neighbor with a stick, according to an arrest report from the Sumter County Sheriff’s Office. The second arrest was considered a violation of her bond from the first arrest.

McKee, who lives at 1301 Fontana Court, has property that backs up to the residence of 89-year-old William Calabrese at 1302 Corona Ave.

He said he had been sitting in his house at about 7 p.m. June 23 when McKee drove her golf cart into his backyard. He walked out the backdoor and asked McKee to leave. Calabrese’s dog ran out the backdoor and began running circles around McKee’s dog, prompting the Buffalo, N.Y. native to swing a stick at her neighbor’s dog. He told her to stop swinging the stick at his dog and he stepped in between them to try to protect his dog. McKee’s stick struck her neighbor in the shoulder. She got back into her golf cart, drove it onto the roadway and went back inside her house.

Prior to her first arrest, sheriff’s deputies had responded five times to disputes involving the warring neighbors. Her June 8 arrest came after Calabrese provided deputies with a photo of McKee on his property, next to his tree with “tree loppers and a garbage can.” The tree was 19 feet from the neighbors’ mutual property line.

McKee, who acknowledged she had been warned multiple times to stay off Calabrese’s property, claimed she “needed to cut down the tree in order to have an effective survey completed.” She showed deputies a satellite image of the property but “had drawn a new line on the image with a pen, cutting through his residence and claiming half of his house was hers also.”

She had previously taken the shears to Calabrese’s peach tree in a previous incident, but it was so close to the property line that no arrest was made in that case.
summary: Janice Frances McKee, 79, from the Village of Hacienda East, served six months in jail after allegedly trimming her neighbor's tree in a long-running dispute. She was released from jail on Dec. 20 and transported to an assisted living/memory care facility in The Villages. McKee's attorney indicated that his client has been diagnosed with dementia and family members granted guardianship over her. She had been free on $2,000 bond when she was arrested a second time on June 23 when she drove onto her neighbor’s lawn with her golf cart and hit her neighbor with a stick. The second arrest was considered a violation of her bond from the first arrest.

title: Kyren Williams runs for 3 TDs and Rams win their third straight by holding off Giants 26-25
description: Kyren Williams ran for 87 yards and a career-best three touchdowns and the Los Angeles Rams inched closer to returning to the playoffs after a year’s absence with a much
content:
EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. (AP) — The Los Angeles Rams inched closer to clinching a postseason berth in a game they didn't look like much of a playoff team — and were somewhat lucky to win.

Kyren Williams ran for 87 yards and a career-best three touchdowns and the Rams won their third straight and sixth in seven games with a much harder-than-expected 26-25 victory over the New York Giants on Sunday.

“We are never going to take for granted being able to get wins,” Rams coach Sean McVay said. “There were things that we did to try to not win this game today. But our guys found a way.

"Sometimes you need these types of games. It seemed we were a little off, but they kept staying together.”

Matthew Stafford threw for 317 yards and a touchdown but also had his first two interceptions in the last five games as the Rams (9-7) won their third straight and sixth in the last seven games. They could clinch a playoff spot later Sunday with a loss by Seattle or a tie between Green Bay and Minnesota.

“We obviously didn’t play best on the offensive side of the ball, but our defense got some critical stops late in the game," said Stafford, who was 24 of 34 passing. “Not the cleanest game, but we found a way to win. A win is a win. It was a crazy game. Felt like I was seeing it well, but obviously made two bad throws.”

The Giants (5-11) had a chance to pull off an upset when Gunner Olszewski scored on a 94-yard punt return to get New York within a point with 3:27 to play. After an encroachment penalty on the extra point attempt, coach Brian Daboll elected to go for a 2-point conversion —but Tyrod Taylor missed a wide-open Saquon Barkley on a rollout to the right.

Taylor admitted having trouble deciding whether run for the 2 points or throw the ball.

“He just missed it,” Daboll said of Taylor, who was 27 of 41 and ran six times for 40 yards while being sacked six times. “We had Saquon. Just short-armed it a little bit.”

Later, a 31-yard run by Taylor allowed Mason Crosby to attempt a game-winning 54-yard field goal, but it was wide left and might have not had the distance.

“I stopped looking when it turned left,” Crosby said.

Williams, the NFL's second leading rusher coming in, scored on runs of 4, 2 and 28 yards. The 2-yard score was set up by an 80-yard catch-and-run by rookie Puka Nacua in the third quarter. A 37-yard pass from Stafford to Demarcus Robinson set up Williams' 28-yard score in the fourth quarter. Rams kicker Lucas Havrisik missed two extra points to keep it close

Taylor threw for 319 yards in his first start since replacing Tommy DeVito, including an 80-yard scoring catch-and-run to Darius Slayton. Wan'Dale Robinson also scored on a 24-yard run on an end-around and Crosby kicked two field goals, but missed an extra point after Slayton's TD that kept the Rams in front 20-16.

Dane Belton had two interceptions and a fumble recovery for New York. Stafford had thrown 170 consecutive passes without an interception until Belton ended the run with his first pick of the season.

Despite turning the ball over twice, Los Angeles led 14-10 at halftime on Williams' 10th rushing touchdown and a 4-yard TD pass from Stafford to Kupp.

A 24-yard end-around by Robinson and a second-chance 31-yard field goal by Crosby accounted for the Giants' scoring. Ben Skowronek blocked Crosby's first attempt from 45 yards, but he was called for unsportsmanlike conduct for making a running leap over the line to block it.

Nacua finished with five catches for 118 yards, leaving him four receptions shy of breaking the NFL single-season record for rookies set by Miami's Jaylen Waddle (104) in 2021. Nacua also needs 29 yards to pass Bill Groman (1,473) for the most yards receiving in a single season by a rookie in franchise history.

Rams: LT Alaric Jackson was inactive for personal reasons. ... NT Bobby Brown hurt his right knee late in the first quarter and did not return.

Giants: Rookie CB Deonte Banks missed the game with a shoulder injury. ... RT Tyre Phillips (ankle) hurt a knee on the opening series, returned and was hurt against in the fourth quarter, needing to be carted off. ... S Jason Pinnock left in the first quarter with a foot injury.

Giants: End the season at home against Philadelphia.
summary: The Los Angeles Rams narrowly beat the New York Giants 26-25, marking their third consecutive win and sixth in seven games. Kyren Williams ran for 87 yards and three touchdowns, while Matthew Stafford threw for 317 yards and a touchdown, but also had his first two interceptions in the last five games. The Rams, who could clinch a playoff spot with a loss by Seattle or a tie between Green Bay and Minnesota, were lucky to win. Despite turning the ball over twice, Los Angeles led 14-10 at halftime. The Giants had a chance to upset when Gunner Olszewski scored on a 94-yard punt return with 3:27 to play, but missed a 2-point conversion attempt by Tyrod Taylor.

title: Iowa High School Student Arrested for having ‘Hit List’ of Staff and Students
description: By KCRG Staff SIDNEY, Iowa (KCRG) – An 18-year-old student at Sidney High School in Fremont County has been arrested after she allegedly had a “hit list” against individuals in […]
content:
SIDNEY, Iowa (KCRG) – An 18-year-old student at Sidney High School in Fremont County has been arrested after she allegedly had a “hit list” against individuals in the school district and the community.

Officials say Kaelyn Surrell had sent the list to at least one individual via Snapchat and that the list included “people she had bad encounters with where she has a motive to carry out harming them.” They say she had wished to cause arson incidents towards the individuals and that, as a Fire Cadet with the Shenandoah Fire Department, had the “potential knowledge to carry out the act.”

Surrell was taken into custody on Tuesday and was charged with seven felony counts of threats of terrorism.
summary: Kaelyn Surrell, an 18-year-old student at Sidney High School in Fremont County, Iowa, has been arrested for allegedly having a "hit list" of individuals in the school district and the community. The list, which includes individuals she had bad encounters with, was sent to at least one individual via Snapchat and included potential arson incidents. Surrell was taken into custody and charged with seven felony counts of threats of terrorism.

title: What topped a poll of the most enjoyable films of 2023?
description: Taylor Swift: Eras Concert Tour, released in October, broke box office records and was well received in Vue International’s poll.
content:
The American singer-songwriter released Taylor Swift: The Eras Tour, which features songs spanning her entire career and attracted a huge reaction from her fans, in October.

Vue International said the film, which featured Swift performing during the US leg of her high-grossing tour, topped ratings from its cinemagoers after feedback surveys completed after their visit this year.

Swift, 34, broke the cinema chain’s record for the most tickets sold during the UK pre-sale opening week for a music event and Odeon had to add more screenings.

To calculate the most enjoyable films, Vue International received more than 67,000 ratings across different films and sorted them by ranking those with more than 250 ratings by the percent of customers who gave it the full five points out of five.

Comedy drama A Man Called Otto, starring Tom Hanks as a man reeling from family tragedy, took second place, while Marvel’s Guardians Of The Galaxy Vol. 3 secured the third spot.

Horror Saw X and Whitney Houston biographical musical drama I Wanna Dance With Somebody came fourth and fifth respectively.

Also appearing in the top 20 were titles such as musicals based on Roald Dahl books such as Matilda The Musical and Wonka, Michael Caine drama The Great Escaper and Disney’s musical fantasy live-action The Little Mermaid.

Notably absent was Barbie, the highest grossing film of 2023, and its rival Oppenheimer.

However, Vue said they scored highly among viewers – but did not make the top 20.

Founder and chief executive of Vue International Tim Richards said: “Taylor Swift: Eras Concert Tour saw the highest ever box office takings for a big screen event release in the UK and Ireland so securing the top spot as the most enjoyable big screen content watched in 2023 is testament to the power of fans, shared social experiences and the growing appreciation of events screened at the cinema.

“We’ve seen some amazing standout performances this year, with movies such as Barbie, Oppenheimer and Super Mario Bros breaking records and bringing a combined £208 million to the UK and Ireland’s box office.

“Throughout the year we’ve also seen great levels of engagement from our customers and demand for the big screen experience across a mix of genres, as reflected in the Vue top 20 which includes music, family and horror titles.

“We love getting feedback from our customers about their visits including these enjoyment scores as it helps us provide the best possible experience in our cinemas and keep our customers coming back.

“We have an exciting line up of content for the year ahead and we’re looking forward to seeing which titles our customers rate as the most enjoyable big screen content of 2024.”

Also voted as the top 20 enjoyable films at the Vue were slasher Scream VI, Chris Pratt-voiced The Super Mario Bros Movie, boxing movie Creed III, action flick Mission: Impossible – Dead Reckoning Part One, comedy-horror Haunted Mansion and science-fiction movie Transformers: Rise Of The Beasts.

Vigilante thriller The Equalizer 3, animated superhero movie Spider-Man: Across The Spider-Verse, action movie John Wick: Chapter 4, Gerard Butler thriller Plane and action film Fast X were also among those seen as most enjoyable in the Vue poll.

I Wanna Dance With Somebody and Matilda The Musical were released in the UK at the end of 2022 and continued to be shown in cinemas this year.

entities.data: Mission: Impossible – Dead Reckoning Part One

summary: Vue International has named its top 20 most enjoyable films of 2023 based on feedback surveys from its cinemagoers. The film, Taylor Swift: The Eras Tour, featured Swift performing during the US leg of her high-grossing tour and topped ratings from the cinema chain. The survey involved over 67,000 ratings across different films and ranked them by the percent of customers who gave it the full five points out of five. Other films included A Man Called Otto, Guardians Of The Galaxy Vol. 3, Saw X and I Wanna Dance With Somebody. However, Barbie and Oppenheimer were not included in the top 20.

title: Lots of sunshine to start 2024
description: After seeing ice and snow this morning across Eastern Iowa, we were left with a cloudy and dreary day. The clouds will decrease as we head into the evening and overnight hours.
content:
CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa (KCRG) - After seeing ice and snow this morning across Eastern Iowa, we were left with a cloudy and dreary day. The clouds will decrease as we head into the evening and overnight hours.

Mostly sunny to partly cloudy skies will greet you for Monday with highs in the mid 30s.

We will go back into the upper 30s for Tuesday.

We will see a front push through as we head into the evening hours and into your Wednesday.

By the weekend, we will see temperatures going back into the upper 30s with partly cloudy skies.

By Tuesday, we will see a drop in temperatures with highs in the mid 20s.
summary: The weather will be mostly sunny and partly cloudy in the early hours of the morning in Eastern Iowa, with temperatures expected to reach highs in the mid 30s for Monday and return to the upper 30s on Tuesday. However, a front will push through as we head into the evening hours and into the Wednesday, bringing temperatures back into the mid-30s. By the weekend, temperatures will return to their mid-40s with partly cloudy skies, but temperatures will drop to mid-20s by Tuesday.

title: Video Shows Russians Urging End to Putin’s War: ‘Government Deceives Us’
description: Russian citizens have spoken out against the war in Ukraine in a newly released video by BBC News as the conflict nears a new milestone.
content:
Russian citizens have spoken out against the war in Ukraine in a newly released video by BBC News as the conflict nears a new milestone.

Russian President Vladimir Putin first launched his invasion of neighboring Ukraine in late February 2022, with the conflict having since dragged on longer than most would have ever predicted as it nears its two-year anniversary. According to estimates from the Ukrainian military, Russian forces have suffered nearly 360,000 deaths in the war, as well as countless losses of military hardware. The Kremlin does not provide a running total of reported Ukrainian losses, but said on Saturday that 660 Ukrainian soldiers had been killed in the past day. could not independently verify either count.

While Ukrainian sources might be inflating such numbers, other experts agree that they reflect a dire situation for Russia’s forces. In addition, Russian citizens have weathered heavy economic sanctions as a result of the invasion.

While Putin and his allies have remained staunchly committed to the conflict, a new video released on Sunday by the BBC showed some reactions from everyday Russian citizens, to the war and to the state of the country in general. The interviews were filmed in the town of Orekhovo-Zuyevo, roughly 60 miles east of Moscow.

“How can there be hope?” one unnamed woman asked. “It’s the same old bureaucrats running things…Our government deceives. That’s what worries me. They rake in the money.”

Another woman, when asked about her hopes for the new year, attempted to brush off the question, stating that she had no hopes.

“If I had a decent pension, then I’d have some hope,” the woman said. “As long as there is no war…I hope it ends. So that it ends.”

“The main thing is that the war ends soon,” an unnamed man said. “Because our young generation are being killed. So many of them. We didn’t need this war. But it wasn’t us who started it.”

It is unclear in the video who the man was blaming for the onset of the war in Ukraine.

At one point in the video, BBC Russia editor Steve Rosenberg noted a massive building mural dedicated to the memory of a young Russian soldier killed in Ukraine. A local museum had been dedicated to the same soldier’s memory.

reached out to Russian officials via email for comment.

Previously speaking with , Beth Knobel, a professor of communications and media studies at Fordham University and former CBS News Moscow bureau chief, gave a blunt prediction for what it might take for the conflict in Ukraine to end next year.

“The only way I can foresee the Ukraine war possibly ending in 2024 is if Vladimir Putin dies,” Knobel said. “It is theoretically possible that Russia could take advantage of a change in leadership to try to declare victory and just hold onto the land it grabbed since February of 2022. But even if Putin dies, I think there’s only a miniscule chance that Russia would back off from the war, because it has already invested so much of its national image in winning.”

keywords.name: former CBS News Moscow bureau chief

summary: Russian citizens have spoken out against the war in Ukraine, accusing the Russian government of deceiving them. The comments were made in a video by BBC News as the conflict nears its two-year anniversary. The Ukrainian military estimates that Russian forces have suffered nearly 360,000 deaths and numerous losses of military hardware in the conflict. While Putin and his allies have remained committed to the conflict, a new video shows everyday Russian citizens' reactions to the war. The interviews were conducted in the town of Orekhovo-Zuyevo, about 60 miles east of Moscow.

title: New Hampshire readies for Manchin visit
description: MANCHESTER, N.H. — One of the organizers of a New Hampshire political event coming up next month said he’s looking forward to hearing what U.S. Senator Joe
content:
MANCHESTER, N.H. — One of the organizers of a New Hampshire political event coming up next month said he’s looking forward to hearing what U.S. Senator Joe Manchin has to say about his vision for the country.

Neil Levesque, director of the New Hampshire Institute of Politics at Saint Anselm College, said organizers asked Manchin to come to the Jan. 12 “Politics & Eggs” event in Manchester after he announced he would not be seeking reelection next year.

“This is a place where there’s going to be a lot of action coincidentally with the New Hampshire Primary coming up, so when he’s here there will be a lot of media attention, there will be a lot of people here engaged in politics,” Levesque said last week on MetroNews “Talkline.”

Manchin has said previously that he’s in search for the middle. He’s not said that he plans on running for president in 2024.

“I start in January, I’ll be two months on the road. And all we’re trying to do is just mobilize people like myself who feel like they’re homeless, politically homeless,” Manchin said at an event hosted by the Wall Street Journal earlier this month.

Levesque said it’s the residents of New Hampshire that play a large role in the “Politics & Eggs” event. He said those speaking, like Manchin, will field several questions.

“They take questions and then they take follow-up questions,” he said. “That’s one of the reasons why the media loves New Hampshire. It’s not a state where you can hide behind a teleprompter.”

Levesque said he expects Manchin to talk his future and what he wants to do for the U.S.

“I think it’s a place where people are going to ask those questions and they’ll get some answers from him,” Levesque said.

The event links Manchin’s appearance to “Americans Together,” described as “a new organization that is creating a platform for the middle to connect and empower moderate voices around the country.”

Manchin and his daughter Heather have been pitching wealthy political donors on supporting a centrist political group with a goal of raising $100 million.

“Their goal is to build a bridge between popular will and political outcomes,” wrote the organizers of the Politics & Eggs event.

When asked on “Talkline” if there is a “middle” in New Hampshire that could get behind Manchin, Levesque said the state is independently-minded.

“We have more undeclared voters than people who are voted in parties in New Hampshire,” he said. “We’re sort of renowned for the fact that the party extremes really do not command the elected offices in New Hampshire.”

The New Hampshire Primary is Jan. 23.

entities.data: the New Hampshire Institute of Politics

summary: Neil Levesque, director of the New Hampshire Institute of Politics at Saint Anselm College, is excited to hear from U.S. Senator Joe Manchin about his vision for the country at a political event in Manchester, New Hampshire on Jan. 12. The event was asked by Manchin after he announced he would not be seeking reelection next year. The timing of the event coincides with the New New Hampshire Primary on 23rd January. The organizers have linked Manchin's appearance to "Americans Together," a new organization aimed at creating a platform for the middle to connect and empower moderate voices across the country.

title: What will the weather be like in the next 24 hours?  The Meteorological Leavement announced this
description: What will the weather be like in the next 24 hours? The Meteorological Leavement announced this
content:
What will the weather be like in the next 24 hours? The Meteorological Leavement announced this

What will the weather be like in the next 24 hours? The Meteorological Leavement announced this

The Meteorological Leavement has made an important forecast about the weather for the next 24 hours.

According to the details, cold and rainless weather will remain in Islamabad, fog is likely at some places in the morning, but most parts of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa will experience cold and rainless weather. While the upper districts will remain very cold, however, Charsada, Mardan, Nowshera, Swabi, Peshawar, DI Khan and surrounding areas are likely to experience fog during the morning and night hours.

The Meteorological Leavement has said that most parts of Punjab will experience cold and dry weather, while Murree, Galliat and surrounding areas, Bahawalpur, Sahiwal, Okara, Kasur, Lahore, Sialkot, Narowal, Gujranwala will experience very cold weather. Jhelum, Mangla, Faisalabad, Jhang, Sargodha, Mandi Bahauddin, Toba Teksing, Khanewal, Multan, Khanpur, Rahim Yar Khan, Hafizabad, Bhakkar, Leh, Dera Ghazai Khan and Gur two districts are likely to experience heavy fog/smog, Potohar. Fog is possible in some areas in the region in the morning hours.

The report also said that weather will remain cold and dry in most parts of Balochistan, while severe cold will persist in northern areas and partly cloudy in western areas. Fog/Smog from Sukkur, Larkana, Dadu, Ghotki and Padai during morning and night hours Gilgit-Baltistan and Kashmir will experience severe cold and dry weather.
summary: The Meteorological Leavement has issued a 24-hour weather forecast for the next 24 hours, with Islamabad expected to remain cold and rainless, while most parts of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa will see cold and rainfallless conditions. However, Charsada, Mardan, Nowshera, Swabi, Peshawar, DI Khan and surrounding areas are likely to experience fog during the morning and night hours. Most parts of Punjab will experience cold and dry weather, while Murree, Galliat, Bahawalpur, Sahiwal, Okara, Kasur, Lahore, Sialkot, Narowal, and Gujranwala will also experience very cold weather. The report also stated that weather will remain cold in most parts Balochistan, while severe cold will persist in northern areas and partly cloudy in western areas.

title: Japan emperor hopes for expanded support for needy people
description: Emperor Naruhito, in a New Year's message on Monday, expressed his wish that support will expand for people facing difficulties.
content:
Emperor Naruhito, in a New Year's message on Monday, expressed his wish that support will expand for people facing difficulties, including those affected by natural disasters and soaring prices.

"I wish moves to support people needing help will increase," the emperor said in the written message, released through the Imperial Household Agency, expressing his sympathy to those who are struggling.

On the global front, Emperor Naruhito said it is painful that many lives are being lost in wars and conflicts.

"I'm reminded of the importance of people trying to understand each other and cooperate to build a peaceful world," he said.

"I pray that the new year will be a year in which people in our country and around the world can move forward with bright hopes."

Emperor Naruhito and Empress Masako were set to attend a ceremony to celebrate the arrival of the new year at the Imperial Palace on Monday. They will greet the public in events at the palace in Tokyo's Chiyoda Ward on Tuesday together with other imperial family members, including Emperor Emeritus Akihito, Empress Emerita Michiko, Crown Prince Akishino and Crown Princess Kiko.

This year, the emperor and the empress will visit Okayama, Saga, Gifu and Oita prefectures for four major annual regional events that are usually attended by the imperial couple.

A plan is being considered for Emperor Naruhito and Empress Masako to travel to Britain, after their 2020 visit to the country was canceled amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

Princess Aiko, the only child of the imperial couple, will graduate from Gakushuin University this spring.

Prince Hisahito, the third child of Crown Prince Akishino and Crown Princess Kiko, will turn 18 in September to become an adult member of the imperial family. Prince Hisahito, who is second in line to the throne, is a second grader at the University of Tsukuba's Senior High School at Otsuka in Tokyo.
summary: Japan's Emperor Naruhito has expressed his wish for increased support for needy individuals in a New Year's message, expressing his sympathy for those suffering from natural disasters and high prices. The message was released through the Imperial Household Agency and released alongside other imperial family members. The emperor and Empress Masako are set to attend a ceremony to celebrate the arrival of the new year at the Imperial Palace and greet the public with events at the palace in Tokyo's Chiyoda Ward. This year, the emperor and the empress will visit Okayama, Saga, Gifu and Oita prefectures for four major regional events, usually attended by the imperial couple. A plan is being considered for Emperor and EmpressMasako to travel to Britain after their 2020 visit was cancelled due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: In Rare Apology, Israeli Minister Says She 'Sinned' for Her Role in Reforms That Tore Country Apart - VINnews
description: JERUSALEM (AP) — A former member of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s Cabinet offered a rare public apology Sunday for contributing to the internal strife in Israel that preceded the Oct. 7 attack by Hamas militants from the Gaza Strip. Join our WhatsApp group Subscribe to our Daily Roundup Email The mea culpa by Galit Distel […]
content:
JERUSALEM (AP) — A former member of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s Cabinet offered a rare public apology Sunday for contributing to the internal strife in Israel that preceded the Oct. 7 attack by Hamas militants from the Gaza Strip.

The mea culpa by Galit Distel Atbaryan, a lawmaker from Netanyahu’s Likud Party, was one of the first times a Likud member has accepted responsibility for the polarized atmosphere ahead of the attack, which triggered a devastating war that has continued for nearly three months.

Distel Atbaryan appeared to accept the argument that the internal divisions created perceptions of weakness that encouraged Hamas to attack.

“I’m here sitting and telling you, the democratic, secular public: I sinned against you, I caused pain for you, I caused you to fear for your lives here, and I am sorry for this,” she told Channel 13 TV.

Distel Atbaryan added that she was taking responsibility for her role in the massive protests and civil discord that erupted after Netanyahu’s right-wing government attempted to implement a far-reaching overhaul of the judicial system. The crisis sparked mass protests, alarmed business leaders and former security chiefs, and drew concern from the United States and other close allies.

“I was one of those people that caused the state to be weakened, that harmed people,” she said. “I created a split, I created a rift, and I created tension. And this tension brought weakness. And this weakness, in many ways, brought massacre.”

Distel Atbaryan, who served as public diplomacy minister, was one of Netanyahu’s strongest supporters and drew attention for her harsh criticism of his opponents.

But days after the Oct. 7 attack, she resigned when it was clear that other government ministries were handling her responsibilities.

Distel Atbaryan said the office was a “waste of public funds” during wartime. She has remained as a member of parliament in the Likud.
summary: Former Israeli Cabinet member, Galit Distel Atbaryan, has publicly apologized for her role in internal strife that led to the Oct. 7 attack by Hamas militants. This apology is one of the first times a Likud member has accepted responsibility for the polarized atmosphere before the attack. Distel said internal divisions created perceptions of weakness that encouraged Hamas to attack. She also acknowledged that her public diplomacy office was a waste of public funds during wartime. Despite resigning from her position after the attack, she remains a member of parliament in the party.

title: Iran releases Spaniard held for more than a year
description: MADRID, Jan 1 — Iran’s embassy in Spain said Sunday that it had released the last Spanish national detained in the country, a tourist who was arrested shortly after he entered...
content:
MADRID, Jan 1 — Iran’s embassy in Spain said Sunday that it had released the last Spanish national detained in the country, a tourist who was arrested shortly after he entered the country in October 2022.

Santiago Sanchez Cogedor was held as protests were roiling Iran after the death in custody of the young Iranian Mahsa Amini, arrested for allegedly violating laws requiring women to cover their heads.

She fell into a coma after what her family said was mistreatment and died in hospital, sparking the unrest.

“The embassy of the Islamic Republic of Iran is pleased to announce the release of Santiago Sanchez Cogedor, the only Spanish citizen detained in Iran,” the Iranian embassy in Spain posted on X.

“His release comes amid friendly and historic relations between the two countries and in accordance with the law,” the embassy added.

Sanchez Cogedor had entered Iran months after the football fan embarked in January 2022 on a long trip by foot toward Qatar to attend the World Cup in November-December.

His family lost all trace of him some weeks before the tournament started.

His last message documenting his adventures on Instagram appeared on October 1, when he wrote that he was in a village in northern Iraq and headed for the Iranian border.

A voice mail to his parents later broadcast by a television station said he was in Tehran headed for the port of Bandar Abbas, in the Strait of Hormuz, from where he intended to take a boat for Qatar.

Some days later his parents learned via the Spanish foreign ministry of his arrest, his mother Celia Cogedor told AFP in late October.

Iran is known to be holding more than 10 Western nationals, and governments and NGOs accuse Tehran of using them as bargaining chips for its own nationals.

Amini’s death became the symbol of a protest movement against enforced wearing of the hijab, and the ensuing repression of protests saw hundreds of deaths and thousands of arrests.

Tehran has accused the United States of fomenting the protests and had announced in September 2022 the arrest of nine foreign nationals from several European states including France, Italy and Poland on the alleged grounds they were linked to the protests. — AFP
summary: Iran's embassy in Spain has released the last Spanish national detained in the country, Santiago Sanchez Cogedor, who was arrested shortly after he entered Iran in October 2022. The release comes amid friendly and historic relations between the two countries, following protests following the death of Iranian woman who was allegedly violating laws requiring women to cover their heads. The death of Mahsa Amini sparked unrest, leading to hundreds of deaths and thousands of arrests. Iran is known to be holding over 10 Western nationals and accusations of using them as bargaining chips for its own nationals.

title: Will Anderson Jr. Impact Immediately Felt on Return
description: Houston Texans Rookie DE made a huge impact during today's Week 17 matchup against the Tennessee Titans
content:
"These last two weeks have been really good mentally, and of course physically getting my ankle back right, resting my body," Anderson said. "But more than anything it was really good mentally just locking in on my faith trusting in and believing in God, but also learning what I could have done better in the past to help me in the future."

As all eyes were on the return of quarterback C.J. Stroud from a concussion, semi-quietly Anderson returned to practice late last week to see if he'd be able to go against the Titans in a crucial AFC South showdown. "All I was thinking about this week was how can I be a warrior, how can I be a competitor," Anderson said about battling back from injury.

Anderson was eventually greenlighted for Sunday's game but on a limited snap count. "I'm really proud of Will for pushing through," Texans coach DeMeco Ryans said. "He's in a lot of pain, he's hurt but still sucked it up and pushed through. He made a lot of impact plays even though he was on a limited snap count. He was still able to affect the quarterback."

On the very next play, backed up to the 45, once again Anderson broke through and slammed down Tannehill into the Texans logo at midfield. A loss of eight yards and pushed back into Titans territory at their own 47. Back-to-back plays. Back-to-back sacks for the rookie in a span of five seconds.

"Back-to-back sacks at any level of football is crazy," Texans defensive tackle Sheldon Rankins said. "For a rookie to do that coming off of injury in his first game back is big time. I know he loved every moment of it. I loved watching it. Just happy for him to continue to have his impact that he's had all season long." The two sacks also made a little history for Anderson. Entering Sunday's game, Anderson had five sacks in his rookie campaign, which placed him fifth all-time on the list. With sacks No. 6 and No. 7 on Sunday, he vaulted to the No. 1 all-time spot.

"None of this happens without those guys in the D-line room," Anderson said. "I give all glory to God for blessing me to be a part of this team and blessing me to be a part of the D-line we have here. "They've been very supportive of me, helping me along the way. When I'm down they pick me right back up. They always keep me grounded, make sure I'm staying focused on the right things. I've got to give a big shoutout to those guys because without God placing them in my life I don't even think I would be where I'm at."

Anderson passed Whitney Mercilus and Brooks Reed who were tied for first all-time with six. Amobi Okoye and J.J. Watt checked in on the list at 5.5 sacks. On the list 10th all-time with 3.5 sacks in 2006 as a rookie is his current head coach – DeMeco Ryans. "For him to break the rookie record, I know that means a lot to him," Ryans said. "That's the type of player Will is. He's an impact player and you see it instantly. You see we've missed him. When he hasn't been there we've missed him. You see the production, you see the type of plays he can make for us. Really proud of him, proud of the season he's having."
summary: Will Anderson Jr. returned from injury to perform well in a crucial AFC South showdown against the Titans, but was limited to a limited snap count. His return made a significant impact on the game, with two sacks that put him fifth all-time on the list. His performance also made history, with Anderson surpassing Whitney Mercilus and Brooks Reed. Despite being on a limited schedule, Anderson's impact was felt immediately. The team's performance was praised by Texans coach DeMeco Ryans. Anderson credits his success to his defensive line and his teammates for their support and determination.

title: Jesus Film Project Unveils New Innovative Animated Film, JESUS - 96five Family Radio
description: JESUS serves as animated remake of the iconic 1979 JESUS film, which holds a Guinness World Record as the most translated film of all time.
content:
The ‘Animated Story of Jesus’ is a new, animated family film about the life of Jesus designed to reach families, new generations, and people of all ages with the story of Jesus.

Anchored in the Gospel of Luke, the film re-imagines the 1979 JESUS film, using much of its dialogue in a refreshed script. The film is slated to release Christmas 2025 and will eventually be in 2,000+ heart languages!

96five’s Alex Milne caught up with Josh Newell, Executive Director of the JESUS Film Project to learn more about the new animated release and the ongoing impact of the original 1979 film.

“It certainly is more than just a movie” Josh said.

“No one could have predicted the impact and certainly the showing in multiple languages. If you would have told them [original producers] that 44 years later it was still having a tremendous impact and ministry all around the world I think everyone would have said you were crazy, in a polite way.

“The word of God is timeless. When we read it, our lives are changes and in a similar way the bible on film or in a visual format has that same type of impact. We’ve seen lives changed all around the world, we know that billions of people have watched it and hundreds of millions have indicated that they’ve started a relationship with Jesus just from watching the Jesus film.”

JESUS (2025) serves as a spectacular remake of the iconic 1979 JESUS film, which holds a Guinness World Record as the most translated film of all time. Fusing unparalleled visual effects and computer graphics, the film benefits from the expertise and talent of a stellar technical and production team, whose credits include Pixar, Disney, and Star Wars.

Dominic Carola, the director of JESUS (2025) has worked on notable animated films such as Mulan, The Lion Kingand Lilo & Stitch and Josh explained that this is about more than entertainment.

“We want it to be compellingly and faithfully telling the story of Jesus in a beautiful artform, in a way that will bring people into the beauty of Jesus’s story and the truth” Josh said.

“We did a lot of research and were thinking about how the story of Jesus could continue to make an impact for this and the next generation, we were hit very squarely with the realization that animation is the medium of this and the next generation. It just made sense.”

Get connected by visiting jesus.film or by downloading the free Insider App to receive regular updates, behind-the-scenes images and ways to pray with us, as the global momentum grows.

Listen to the full interview with Josh Newell in the audio player above.
summary: The Jesus Film Project (JESUS) has unveiled a new animated family film, JESUS (2025), about the life of Jesus. The film reimagines the 1979 JESIS film, using much of its dialogue in a refreshed script and is set to be released in 2025 and will be in 2,000+ heart languages. The director of JISUS (2020), Dominic Carola, has worked on notable animated films such as Mulan, The Lion King, and Lilo & Stitch, the film benefits from the expertise and talent of a stellar technical and production team. 96five's Alex Milne caught up with Josh Newell to discuss the new animated release and the impact of the original 1979 film on lives globally.

title: Kristen Doute Net Worth
description: Discover Kristen Doute's journey from "Vanderpump Rules" to a $1.1M net worth. Explore her 2023 comeback, entrepreneurial spirit and more.
content:
Kristen Doute’s multifaceted career path, which spans acting, authorship, entrepreneurship, and reality TV, signifies her as a notable figure in the entertainment industry, with an estimated net worth of $1.1 million. My specialized analysis, based on an in-depth review over the past few weeks, highlights her prominence from “Vanderpump Rules” and her resilience following a significant setback in 2020. Her comeback in 2023 marks a pivotal moment in her career, reflecting her enduring appeal and versatility.

Despite the controversy, Doute’s expansive portfolio, including roles in films, a published book in 2020, a podcast since 2022, a fashion line, and a venture into the beverage industry, underscores her entrepreneurial spirit and creative dynamism. My dedicated research over recent months underscores that her journey exemplifies resilience and adaptability, as she navigates various ventures and prepares for new opportunities in the spotlight, promising continued growth and success.

In June 2020, Bravo took decisive action against Kristen, Stassi Schroeder, Max Boyens, and Brett Caprioni, terminating their contracts following the re-emergence of racially insensitive remarks and behaviors. Stassi and Kristen faced dismissal after it came to light that they had called the police to falsely accuse Faith Stowers, a fellow cast member of color, of theft. The catalyst for their actions was an article in the “Daily Mail” featuring a black woman engaged in theft, leading them to incorrectly identify Faith as the culprit and report her to the authorities, despite clear evidence indicating otherwise.

Kristen Doute, born on February 17, 1983, in Dearborn, Michigan, is recognized by her full name, Kristen Louise Doute. She hails from a diverse heritage, with roots tracing back to both Irish and Lebanese origins.

Upon relocating to Los Angeles, Kristen secured a position as a server at SUR Restaurant & Lounge in West Hollywood, an establishment owned by Lisa Vanderpump. Her journey into the public eye commenced in 2013 when she became a cast member on the Bravo reality series “Vanderpump Rules.” The show chronicles the lives of the staff at SUR, Tom Tom Restaurant, and Pump Restaurant. Kristen played a prominent role in the series until 2020, making a comeback for season 10 in 2023, accumulating appearances in over 160 episodes.

In 2014, Kristen ventured into the world of fashion by launching the James Mae clothing line. Notably, she reinvigorated the brand in 2019 alongside Magen Mattox. Their collection boasts garments crafted from “either recycled fabrics or fabrics made from recycled water bottles.” In the same year, Kristen diversified her entrepreneurial endeavors by introducing two pinot grigio wines, Basic Witch Potion No. 1 and Basic Witch Potion No. 2, in collaboration with Stassi Schroeder and Katie Maloney under Stephen Amell’s Nocking Point Wines. Unfortunately, Nocking Point discontinued the sale of both wines following Kristen and Stassi’s departure from “Vanderpump Rules.” However, in April 2023, the company announced the relaunch of Basic Witch Potion No. 1.

Between 2007 and 2013, Kristen was romantically involved with Tom Sandoval, a fellow cast member on “Vanderpump Rules.” Unfortunately, their relationship came to an end due to Doute’s involvement with Jax Taylor, another co-star on the show. Following this, Kristen had relationships with James Kennedy, also a cast member, and photographer Brian Carter. In 2020, she embarked on a new romance with realtor Alex Menache, but their relationship came to an end in June 2022. Towards the end of 2022, Doute publicly announced her relationship with Luke Broderick, her co-host on “Sex, Love, and What Else Matters.”

Beyond her romantic endeavors, Kristen has maintained a vegetarian lifestyle since the ’90s. In 2016, she launched Vegiholic, a website dedicated to the vegetarian way of life. In an interview with “Bustle,” she clarified her approach, stating, “I don’t have a culinary background, so I’m not trying to pretend that I’m a chef or I’m a dietician or whatever. Everything that’s on the blog right now is kind of stuff I messed around in the kitchen with. I think the hardest part for me with this blog has been actually writing recipes, because I’ve never done that before.”

In 2019, Kristen invested $1 million in the acquisition of a 1,770 square foot residence situated in the Valley Village region of Los Angeles. Subsequently, she listed the three-bedroom, 2.5-bathroom property for sale at $1.3 million in 2021.
• This article provides an overview of Kristen Doute’s versatile career, spanning acting, authorship, entrepreneurship, and reality TV, with a net worth at $1.1 million. It underscores her resurgence in 2023 and resilience after facing setbacks in 2020.
• The piece delves into controversies, notably her Bravo contract termination, and touches on her early life, relationships, vegetarian lifestyle, and real estate ventures, including a $1 million home purchase in 2019 and a subsequent $1.3 million listing in 2021.

entities.data: Sex, Love, and What Else Matters

summary: Kristen Doute, a prominent figure in the entertainment industry, is estimated to be worth $1.1 million. Her diverse career spans her roles in films, authorship, entrepreneurship, and reality TV. Her comeback in 2023 marks a pivotal moment in her career, reflecting her enduring appeal and versatility. Despite a significant setback in 2020, Doute's portfolio includes roles in film, a published book, a podcast since 2022, a fashion line, and a venture into the beverage industry. She also introduced two pinot grigio wines in collaboration with Stassi Schroeder and Katie Maloney under Stephen Amell’s Nocking Point Wines. Despite controversy surrounding her departure from “Vanderpump Rules” and subsequent termination of her contracts, she remains committed to her entrepreneurial spirit and creative dynamism.

title: Serbia's Rapidly Advancing Drone Technology Raises Concerns Over Lack of Regulation
description: - ISP Today
content:
Serbia has been steadily acquiring more sophisticated drones in recent years, but experts warn that the lack of regulation and oversight surrounding their use is deeply concerning. These advanced drones, equipped with sensors, artificial intelligence, high-quality cameras, and powerful zooms, have the potential to significantly impact privacy and civil liberties due to the absence of clear guidelines governing their deployment.

According to Svetlana Stanarevic, a professor from Belgrade’s Faculty of Security, the extensive data collection capabilities of drones pose a genuine threat to privacy when there are no clear regulations in place. Citizen awareness of the implications of this technology is also lacking, further exacerbating the risks.

While the Serbian police employ drones for various purposes such as rescue missions, border surveillance, and firefighting, their use is subject to loose regulation under the country’s Law on Police. The law permits police to record public events when there is a potential threat to human life or property but requires public announcements when recording in specific spaces. Biometric surveillance and the use of biometric cameras are illegal in Serbia, although there have been attempts to introduce amendments allowing their implementation.

The lack of transparency surrounding the Serbian police’s acquisition of drones is concerning. While the institutions are required to publish data on public procurements, detailed information about the police’s drone purchases is hard to find. Chinese DJI drones, Yuneec Typhoon Q500 drones, and Romanian unmanned aerial Hirrus vehicles are among the models identified through public procurement searches and publicized photographs.

The advanced features of Chinese DJI drones, such as intelligent flying options, active object tracking, and automated flight route automation, raise additional questions about their potential misuse. The connected cameras’ ability to memorize specific objects or faces from previous recordings is a particular concern for privacy advocates. Furthermore, the drones’ carrying capacity, which can accommodate larger cameras and additional devices, grants the potential to mount speakers, radars, or lights.

It is crucial for Serbia to address the regulatory gaps surrounding drone use to ensure citizens’ rights and protect privacy. Clear guidelines regarding data collection, storage, and usage, as well as stricter oversight of law enforcement agencies, would be necessary steps forward for responsible and ethical drone implementation in the country.

1. What are the concerns raised about drone use in Serbia?

 The concerns raised about drone use in Serbia relate to the lack of regulation and oversight surrounding their deployment. The advanced capabilities of these drones, such as extensive data collection, high-quality cameras, and artificial intelligence, pose significant threats to privacy and civil liberties.

2. What are the main uses of drones by the Serbian police?

 The Serbian police employ drones for various purposes, including rescue missions, border surveillance, and firefighting.

3. What is the current regulation for drone use in Serbia?

 Drone use in Serbia is subject to loose regulation under the country’s Law on Police. While the law permits police to record public events in certain cases, there are no clear guidelines for their deployment, which raises concerns about privacy.

4. Are there any attempts to introduce amendments to the existing regulations?

 Yes, there have been attempts to introduce amendments that would allow the use of biometric surveillance and biometric cameras, which are currently illegal in Serbia.

5. What is the lack of transparency surrounding the Serbian police’s acquisition of drones?

 While institutions are required to publish data on public procurements, detailed information about the Serbian police’s drone purchases is hard to find, raising concerns about the lack of transparency.

6. Which drone models have been identified through public procurement searches?

 Chinese DJI drones, Yuneec Typhoon Q500 drones, and Romanian unmanned aerial Hirrus vehicles are among the drone models identified through public procurement searches and publicized photographs.

7. What additional concerns are raised about Chinese DJI drones?

 The advanced features of Chinese DJI drones, such as intelligent flying options, active object tracking, and automated flight route automation, raise questions about their potential misuse. The drones’ connected cameras’ ability to memorize specific objects or faces from previous recordings is a particular concern for privacy advocates.

8. What steps need to be taken in Serbia to address the regulatory gaps surrounding drone use?

 It is crucial for Serbia to establish clear guidelines regarding data collection, storage, and usage for drones. Stricter oversight of law enforcement agencies is also necessary to ensure responsible and ethical drone implementation in the country.

1. Drones: Unmanned aerial vehicles used for various purposes, equipped with sensors, cameras, and other advanced features.

 2. Biometric surveillance: The use of biometric technology, such as facial recognition, for surveillance purposes.

 3. Procurement: The process of acquiring goods or services, including through public purchases.

 4. Privacy advocates: Individuals or groups that advocate for the protection of privacy rights.
summary: Serbian experts have raised concerns over the lack of regulation and oversight surrounding the use of advanced drones, which could significantly impact privacy and civil liberties. The advanced drones are equipped with sensors, artificial intelligence, high-quality cameras, and powerful zooms. While the Serbian police uses them for various purposes such as rescue missions, border surveillance, and firefighting, their use is subject to loose regulation under the country’s Law on Police. The lack of clear guidelines regarding data collection, storage, and usage, stricter oversight of law enforcement agencies, are crucial steps forward for responsible and ethical drone implementation in the country. The author also highlighted concerns about Chinese DJI drones' potential misuse, highlighting their ability to memorize specific objects or faces from previous recordings.

title: 18-year-old man drowns while duck hunting near Georgia/North Carolina
description: An 18-year-old man drowned while duck hunting near the border of Georgia and North Carolina.On Saturday, Nov. 18, Clay County, North Carolina 911 dispatchers received a 911 call reporting a drowning
content:
An 18-year-old man drowned while duck hunting near the border of Georgia and North Carolina.

On Saturday, Nov. 18, Clay County, North Carolina 911 dispatchers received a 911 call reporting a drowning in a remote section of Lake Chatuge.

The area is inaccessible by automobile and offshore from government land just north of the Georgia state line.

A Clay County Sheriff’s Office sergeant and a volunteer took a boat to the location of the drowning.

At about 11:20 a.m., Clay County Sheriff Mark Buchanan and another volunteer also arrived by boat.

They learned the victim, Trenton Daniel Johnson, 18, from Ellijay, was duck hunting with Carson Bentley, also from Ellijay.

Bentley told deputies that after downing a duck, he and Johnson were in the boat and he began to start the boat motor.

At that time, Bentley looked up and saw Johnson topple head-first into the water.

Bentley said he jumped into the water and tried to get a life jacket on Johnson, but was unable to do so.

The sheriff and sergeant could see Johnson’s boots suspended about four feet below the surface of the water and they retrieved his body.

Johnson drowned in water that was between 10 and 12 feet deep and about 40 to 50 feet away from the shoreline.

The Clay County Sheriff’s Office urges anyone boating to always wear a life jacket, especially this time of the year when cold water makes swimming more difficult.

EMEA Tribune is not involved in this news article, it is taken from our partners and or from the News Agencies. Copyright and Credit go to the News Agencies, email [email protected] Follow our WhatsApp verified Channel
summary: An 18-year-old man from Ellijay, North Carolina, Trenton Daniel Johnson, drowned while duck hunting near the border of Georgia and North Carolina on Saturday, Nov. 18. The incident occurred in a remote section of Lake Chatuge, which is inaccessible by automobile and offshore from government land. A Clay County Sheriff’s Office sergeant and a volunteer arrived by boat to the location of the drowning. They retrieved Johnson's body from the water, which was between 10 and 12 feet deep and about 40 to 50 feet away from the shoreline. The sheriff's Office has urged anyone boating to always wear a life jacket, especially this time of the year.

title: Deadline passes, but PGA Tour and Saudis plan to continue negotiations
description: The PGA Tour notified its members in a memo Sunday that it had not reached a final agreement with the PIF but said it has made progress.
content:
The PGA Tour and the Saudi Arabia Public Investment Fund were set to miss a midnight deadline Monday to agree to a formal partnership, but both sides were expected to continue negotiations with the hopes of reaching final terms to align forces at some point in the new year. Uncover your Newsprint: Find out what your 2023 reading says about you. The PGA Tour notified its members in a memo Sunday evening that it had not reached a final agreement with the PIF but said “we are working to extend our negotiations into next year based on the progress we have made to date.” No formal extension had been signed, according to two people familiar with the situation, though recent talks have been productive and both the tour and PIF officials were willing to continue negotiations to see if a final deal can be reached.

But negotiations with the PIF have been complicated from the day the initial framework agreement was announced June 6. Though neither side formally agreed to an extension, the two people familiar with the talks said there has been progress and both sides wanted to keep working toward a final deal, which is still likely at least a month or two away.

“While we had initially set a deadline of December 31, 2023, to reach an agreement, we are working to extend our negotiations into next year based on the progress we have made to date,” Monahan told players in the memo. “Our goal for 2024 is to reach agreements with SSG, PIF and the DP World Tour, bringing them on board as minority co-investors in PGA TOUR Enterprises. These partnerships will allow us to unify, innovate and invest in the game for the benefit of players, fans and sponsors.”

The Dec. 31 deadline was one of the few binding elements of the initial framework of an agreement between the tour and the Saudis. At the time, both sides were hopeful that negotiating the final terms of their alliance would take only a few weeks, but seven months later several wrinkles remain. The proposed partnership instantly faced congressional pushback and the likelihood of scrutiny from federal regulators, and for weeks both sides have said an extension of the deadline was increasingly likely.

The extended talks means the PGA Tour’s new calendar year begins this week with no clarity on what the future holds for professional golf. The Sentry tees off Thursday in Maui without its defending champion, after Jon Rahm signed with LIV Golf last month, and the cloud of uncertainty promises to linger for at least several more weeks.

The PGA Tour is a non-profit organization but is aiming to launch a separate for-profit entity that will oversee its commercial interests, called PGA Tour Enterprises. The Saudi PIF was expected to inject billions into the new entity with its governor, Yasir Al-Rumayyan, serving as board chair and LIV Golf falling under the tour’s umbrella. Without a final deal in place, the board construction and future of LIV have been up in the air, and the PGA Tour is deep in discussions with other investors as it moves forward with plans to launch the new entity.

The tour could receive a 10-figure investment from a group of high-powered sports owners that includes Arthur Blank, who owns the NFL’s Atlanta Falcons; Mark Attanasio, owner of MLB’s Milwaukee Brewers; John Henry and Tom Werner, whose holdings including MLB’s Boston Red Sox; and Wyc Grousbeck, owner of the NBA’s Boston Celtics. The group is called Strategic Sports Group and is led by Fenway Sports Group, the Boston-based private holding company that owns the Red Sox, Fenway Park, Liverpool Football Club and the NHL’s Pittsburgh Penguins.

It is not clear how the group and the Saudis would co-exist as partners with the PGA Tour, though people close to the negotiations have said the two investment groups would serve as minority investors and tour officials would retain a controlling interest in the new commercial entity. The parties have spent the past several weeks trying to decide how to divide that pie, while also discussing how to give tour golfers an equity stake in the new venture and what role team golf — or LIV Golf — might play in the future.

The tour and the Saudi PIF shocked the golf world when they announced an alliance in June. They had negotiated in secret the basic framework of a deal to combine their commercial interests under one umbrella, drop their litigation against each other and begin working cooperatively. While the dueling lawsuits were dropped in June, they had until the end of the year to hammer out terms of a final agreement.

In announcing the preliminary deal, the game’s stakeholders sold it to the public by saying it would draw the divided golf world back together, stabilize the game and ensure the long-term viability of the PGA Tour. The announcement, though, surprised and upset many players and immediately drew the interest of both Congress and Justice Department regulators who oversee mergers and were already investigating the PGA Tour for possible antitrust violations. The turbulence was immediate, and tour officials told lawmakers at a Senate subcommittee hearing that it was difficult to negotiate with so much public scrutiny. Those officials also warned that final terms were still a ways off.

entities.data: the Saudi Arabia Public Investment Fund

summary: The PGA Tour and the Saudi Arabia Public Investment Fund were set to miss a midnight deadline on Monday to agree to a formal partnership, but both parties are expected to continue negotiations in the hope of reaching final terms. The deadline had been set for December 31, 2023, and both the tour and PIF officials have expressed willingness to continue discussions to reach a final deal. Negotiations with the PIF have been ongoing since June 6, when the tour announced an alliance with the Saudi PIF. The agreement was initially expected to provide a framework for a deal, but several issues remain, including congressional pushback and scrutiny from federal regulators. The future of professional golf is uncertain as the PGA tour is set to begin its new calendar year without a final agreement.

title: Over 10,000 Ukrainian entrepreneurs receive UAH 2.4B in gov’t grants
description: More than 10,000 Ukrainians have become winners of the "Own Business" grant program since its inception, having received UAH 2.4 billion from the government to start or develop their business. — Ukrinform.
content:
More than 10,000 Ukrainians have become winners of the "Own Business" grant program since its inception, having received UAH 2.4 billion from the government to start or develop their business.

This was reported by the Ministry of Economy, Ukrinform saw.

The government allocated UAH 91.2 million for 378 applicants to the "Own Business" grant program. In particular, 354 winners received microgrants in the amount of UAH 82 million for opening or developing their own businesses, and 24 winners got UAH 9.2 million within the veteran campaign.

"The latest winners of the Own Business grant program` received more than UAH 90 million from the state for starting a business or expanding an existing one. Micro-grants of up to UAH 250,000 are most in demand among Ukrainians. At the same time, veterans and their spouses can receive a much larger grant for business development – up to UAH 1 million. To date, more than 10,000 Ukrainians have seized the opportunity to take a grant and are now implementing their business ideas," said Deputy Minister of Economy Tetiana Berezhna.

In total, more than 10,000 Ukrainians have already received UAH 2.4 billion in grants for their businesses since the program was launched. They can spend money on purchasing or leasing the equipment, purchasing raw materials and components, and renting premises. Both experienced entrepreneur and those without experience can receive a microgrant. A mandatory condition for providing funds is for the business to create at least one or two jobs, depending on the amount of the grant.

As reported, under the Own Business grant program, Ukrainians can receive a micro-grant from UAH 50,000 to UAH 250,000.
summary: Over 10,000 Ukrainian entrepreneurs have received UAH 2.4 billion in grants from the government since its inception, according to the Ministry of Economy. The government allocated UAH 91.2 million for 378 applicants to the "Own Business" grant program, with 354 winners receiving microgrants totalling UAH 82 million for opening or developing their own businesses, and 24 winners received over UAH 9.2 billion within the veteran campaign. The grant program allows Ukrainians to receive a microgrant from UAH 50,000 to UAH 250,000, depending on the amount of the grant. Both experienced entrepreneurs and those without experience can receive grants. A mandatory condition for providing funds is for the business to create at least one or two jobs.
